 We offer you an opportunity to really make a difference for both future and existing customers by leading or being a part of complex implementation projects of our HCM (Human Capital Management) platform. We always aim to onboard our customers in a way that brings them the most value of our platform as quickly as possible and empowers them to continue the adaption of their solution as their journey unfolds – in close partnership with us. The system implementation project plays an essential part in that promise.
 



  





  





**What you’ll do as HCM Solutions Consultant:** 



* Work to optimise the outcome for the specific customer:
* Be a partner to the customer; be curious and gain insights about the customer to support, coach and challenge them to the best solution considering their specific needs, visions
* Secure minimized time to value for the customer
* Always consider the big picture: see the connection between the setup of data and configuration of processes in the system in relation to the effect integrations have on the existing system landscape
* Secure that the project is on time, within the scope and within budget and properly document project progress, solution, and decisions in CatalystOne Projects
* In the role of Project Manager, manage multiple implementation projects by simultaneously taking the main responsibility for the overall project with regards to schedule, scope, structure, resources, communication, risks, and stakeholders
* In the role of HR Consultant, act as solution and system expert during configuration and data migration, run customer meetings and training sessions
* Secure we stay relevant to our customers by contributing to the continuous improvement of implementation methodology and material - in collaboration with and under the leadership of the Centre of Excellence
* Secure product requests from customers are propagated to Product Management via the established channels
* Actively share knowledge of trends, common practices, and other relevant insights



  





  





**Requirements:** 



* Experience with implementing business-critical applications (HCM, ERP, Payroll, T&A etc.).
* Several years of experience working as a consultant
* Can "talk" IT with HR and vice versa
* Strong organization and time management skills
* Excellent communication and leadership skills
* Contributes to an inspirational and motivating working environment
* Fluent in a Scandinavian language, as well as English



  





  





**Benefits** 




 As well as your salary, you’ll receive:
 


* 30 days’ vacation per year
* Pension and insurance package, including private healthcare
* Wellness contribution
* Laptop, Mobile phone & subscription, and home internet allowance
* Flexibility to work in a hybrid setup
* And more…



  





  





 CatalystOne is a Scandinavian leader of HCM-software with nearly 250 employees throughout Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and India (R&D). We have, since 2004, built a strong value-based company driven by our customers' success. Our culture is characterized by a unique combination of emphasis on results and on people. We have experienced high growth in recent years and have the ambition to continue this growth both in Scandinavia and in other North-European countries.
 



  





 CatalystOne is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic.
 



  





*CatalystOne does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters. CatalystOne will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to the specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to CatalystOne on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.* 




  





**We would like to inform you that all candidates who receive a job offer will be subject to a background check.**

title: Junior Art Director
description:
**About Transparent** 




 We're a passionate team dedicated to designing high-quality, meaningful, and beautiful speakers that seamlessly blend into any space. We believe in the power of meticulous design – every detail, from the perfect typographic balance to considered colour palettes. Transparent is more than just a word - it's a commitment to authenticity and seeing the world for what it is.
 



  





 Since our founding in Stockholm in 2012, we've been an independent brand challenging the unsustainable norms of the tech industry. We're looking for a like-minded Junior Art Director Intern to join our team and help craft the future of the Transparent brand.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As our Junior Art Director, you'll be a guardian of the Transparent aesthetic. Working closely with our Creative Director, you'll play a key role in refining and developing our visual identity. You'll be responsible for creating impactful visual communication that captures the essence of our brand across various digital platforms and physical touchpoints, always with an eye for detail and balance. As we are a small and dynamic team you will also be asked to help out in other areas where it makes sense. We seek passionate, ambitious, smart, and, above all, kind individuals. We welcome those from diverse backgrounds with different perspectives on problem-solving.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 



* **Visual Identity Development:** 
 Refine and evolve our visual language across all brand touchpoints, ensuring consistency and precision. Think website design, packaging, social media, and more.
* **Visual Communication and Style Creation:** 
 Design eye-catching visuals for our marketing materials, social media channels, and other platforms.
* **Editing and Motion Design:** 
 Develop your skills in motion graphics by creating short, engaging videos and animations that showcase the beauty and functionality of our products.
* **Curating the Transparent Feed:** 
 You'll be bringing our brand to life on social platforms, making sure all assets are produced and published in a timely manner.



  





**Who You Are:** 



* A creative thinker with a discerning eye for design and a deep appreciation for minimalist aesthetics
* Passionate about typography, layout, and creating visually compelling compositions
* Results-oriented with the ability to meet deadlines
* Committed to creating thoughtful design solutions
* Willing to learn and grow in a dynamic and fast moving environment
* Reliable and meticulous in your work



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Graphic design skills: Ability to create pixel perfect compositions in different formats.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (especially Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and After Effects) and/or Figma, Canva, or similar design tools.
* A strong portfolio demonstrating creativity, technical skill, and a sense for typography, grids and composition
* Experience creating thumb-stopping content for social media
* Strong grasp of design principles and ability to apply them consistently
* Strong ability to work independently and in a team
* Interest in audio technology and product design is a plus
* Interest in photography or 3d rendering with studio lightning is a plus
* Interest in synthography and other emerging AI creative methods is a plus
* Interest in sustainable and circular design principles is a plus



  





**What We Offer:** 



* **Real-World Experience:** 
 Gain hands-on experience working closely with the founders of a growing company that celebrates meticulous, detail-oriented design work.
* **Mentorship and Growth:** 
 Learn the ins and outs of building a successful, progressive and values driven brand identity from from our experienced Creative Director
* **Dynamic and global environment:** 
 Transparent work on many exciting collaborative projects across the world with some of the biggest names in music and the creative industry.
* **Creative Impact:** 
 See your ideas and designs come to life and have a direct impact on a brand that values creativity.
* **Compensation:** 
 Equivalent to student finance (CSN) level, with potential for a full-time position upon successful completion of the 6 month internship.

title: Procurement Manager
description:
What you’ll do at Elekta
   

  

 At Elekta, we don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer. In the role as Procurement Manager you will be a part of our Indirect Procurement team based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 This role will be responsible for indirect procurement for Elekta’s Nordic sites and factory as well as some regional focus on EU & TIMEA entities within the Elekta Group.
   

  

 The purpose of the Procurement Manager role is to manage Elekta’s spend on indirect products and services across a number of commodities, focusing on achieving results for quality, cost and on time delivery. The role will involve the deployment of indirect sourcing policies and the day to day management of the electronic purchase sourcing and requisition tools.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In addition to the above, the Procurement Manager will also be responsible for:
   

  

* Collaborate with the Global Category Managers to align plan and sourcing activities
* Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business requirements.
* Lead in the selection of suppliers in compliance with the Elekta sourcing process whilst ensuring selection is robust and fit for purpose
* Ensure robust supply agreements are in place with key suppliers
* Negotiation of best practice terms with suppliers.
* Develop and execute third party sourcing initiatives
* Reduce and consolidate the approved indirect supplier vendor list.
* Monitor supplier’s performance cost, quality, delivery, and contract compliance.
* Implement and manage supplier management meetings as and when required
* Introduce open book costing and/or competitive tendering where appropriate.
* Maintain all system parameters and data integrity for Procurement systems.
* Act as expert for indirect purchasing systems/processes and deliver training on these as and when required
* Drive utilization of Coupa including ensuring a high level of purchase order coverage and by appropriate usage of the sourcing module.
* Work closely with the key stakeholders to develop effective cost reduction and efficiency strategies through to implementation plans with supporting business cases presenting benefits to the business
* Identify and promote opportunities for business improvement
* Additional responsibilities cover benchmarking activities in: indirect material spend, supplier consolidation opportunities, identifying market trends, and supply trends.


 What you bring
   

  

* Previous Buying or Category Management experience essential, ideally for indirect categories.
* Previous experience of working with indirect purchasing systems
* Successful track record in a global procurement organization
* Ability to work autonomously and integrate with remote procurement team and business stakeholders.
* Ability to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of sourcing strategy deployment, financial concepts and the ability to create business cases
* Excellent negotiation and supplier management skills
* Experience with contract management and awareness and understanding of contractual law
* Strong communication skills with the ability to liaise with internal and external stakeholders at all levels
* Advanced MS Excel and Power Point skills
* Fluent in English and Swedish


 Why should you join Elekta?
   

  

 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop. In addition to this our benefit package include:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year + additional 4 Elekta days off /year
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme
* Private Medical Insurance
* Lunch Benefit
* Contribution to wellness activities
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week)


 Hiring process
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail. Last day for applying is 25th August, 2024.
   

  

 Your Elekta contact
   

  

 For questions, please contact the responsible TA Partner Oscar at Oscar.persson@elekta.com.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer.
   

  

 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.
   

  

 We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: Finance Lead
description:
**About Spritju**
 Spritju is a Swedish B2B platform that revolutionizes the trading and management of Energy Attribute Certificates (EACs) by leveraging blockchain and AI technology. Spritju enhances energy traceability, reduces procurement costs, and offers hourly granularity in compliance with global standards. The platform addresses greenwashing by providing real-time verification of energy sources, making it a crucial tool for businesses committed to sustainability .
   

  

**Position Overview**
 The Finance Lead at Spritju will play a critical role in driving the company's financial strategy and growth initiatives. This role will perform all financial aspects of the company, including fundraising, financial planning, and accounting, to ensure Spritju's financial health and operational success. The role will work closely with the CEO and other members of the executive team to guide the company through its next phase of growth.
   

  

**Fundraising & Capital Strategy**
 Develop and execute comprehensive fundraising strategies to support Spritju’s growth objectives, including equity, debt, and alternative financing. Build and maintain strong relationships with investors, financial institutions, and other stakeholders to secure necessary funding. Lead negotiations with investors, ensuring optimal deal structures and terms. Prepare and present compelling financial narratives to potential and existing investors.
   

  

**Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)**
 Oversee the development of financial models and forecasts to guide the company's strategic decision-making. Lead the annual budgeting process and quarterly re-forecasting, ensuring alignment with company goals. Provide insightful financial analysis to the executive team, highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities. Monitor financial performance against budgets and forecasts, implementing corrective actions as needed.
   

  

**Accounting & Financial Reporting**
 Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of financial reporting and accounting functions
   

  

**Strategic Leadership & Collaboration**
 Serve as a key member of the executive team, contributing to overall company strategy and decision-making. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive operational efficiencies and optimize financial performance. Provide leadership and mentorship to the finance and accounting team, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. Stay abreast of industry trends and economic conditions to proactively adapt financial strategies.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Bachelor's or master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field; MBA or CPA is highly desirable.
   

  

 A minimum of 7 years of progressive financial leadership experience, preferably as a Finance Lead. Proven track record in fundraising and capital strategy, with experience securing various forms of financing. Strong understanding of financial planning, analysis, and accounting principles. Excellent leadership, communication, and negotiation skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a high degree of adaptability.
   

  

**Why Join Spritju?**
 Opportunity to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of a high-growth company. Collaborative and innovative work environment. Competitive compensation package with equity options.
   

  

 Spritju is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 ahmad.karnama@spritju.com or phone number 0046725382565

title: Senior Test Manager - upprätta kvalitetssäkringsstrategin för ny regional sjukvårdslösning
description:
**Senior Test Manager – upprätta kvalitetssäkringsstrategin för ny regional sjukvårdslösning**
*Vill du jobba i ett helt nytt sjukvårdsprogram? Detta är en unik möjlighet att bli en del av ett företag och affärsområde med höga ambitioner. I samarbete med fantastiska kollegor kommer du att ingå i en internationell strategi och expansion – Låter det intressant? Ta den här möjligheten nu!*
**Systematic Healthcare – säkerställer ett sammanhängande sjukvårdssystem**
 Systematics Healthcare-lösningar är implementerade och används av mer är 200 000 användare i länder som Danmark, Norge, Sverige, Finland, Nederländerna, Storbritannien och så långt borta som Nya Zeeland. Vi tillhandahåller våra lösningar till ledande internationella universitetssjukhus inklusive UMC Utrecht, Århus Universitetssjukhus och Nya Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset. Våra sjukvårdslösningar sammanför kliniker och optimerar patientrelaterade arbetsflöden från början till slut.
   

  

**Columna – Systematics EMR-lösning**
 Columna ger tydliga, handlingsbara och enkla översikter av en patients behandlingsförlopp samtidigt som det stödjer dokumentationen av behandlingen och kliniska uppgifter. Lösningen stödjer effektivt hantering av läkemedel, kliniska mätningar, anteckningar och behandlingar, samt ger en överblick över patientens sjukdomshistoria, diagnoser och kontakter inom sjukvården. Lösningen säkerställer överensstämmelse mellan klinisk dokumentation och behov av patientadministration. Lösningen har genom åren utvecklats i nära samarbete med kliniska användare för att stödja deras arbete på bästa möjliga sätt.
   

  

 Vi har ett strategiskt fokus på ytterligare expansion på de nordiska och globala sjukvårdsmarknaderna. Följ med på denna resa, där du verkligen kan påverka utvecklingen och implementeringen av sjukvårdslösningar i Sverige och hela Norden.
   

  

**Senior Test Manager:
   

 leder kvalitetssäkringen i ett av de största EMR-implementeringsprojekten i Norden**
 Med hänvisning till vår Program Director kommer du här att få en unik möjlighet att agera som drivkraft för kvalitetssäkringen i den första implementeringen av vårt journalsystem utanför Danmark. Du kommer att vara delaktig i processen, ända från planeringsfasen tills den går live, och med en erfaren organisation i ryggen kommer du att vara med och säkerställa vår fortsatta internationella tillväxtstrategi.
   

  

 Som Senior Test Manager ansvarar du för att planera och genomföra testprogrammet för projekten i Region Stockholm. Du kommer att ansvara för att leveransen sker enligt programplanens ramar:
   

 tid, budget och kvalitet, samt huruvida kunden känner att de är en del av framgången och får ut mesta möjliga av sin EMR-lösning. Kort sagt, din vardag kommer bland annat att innehålla följande uppgifter:
   

  

* Planera, samordna och effektivisera alla inledande testaktiviteter i samarbete med Systematics utvecklingsavdelning, kunden, programansvarig och underleverantörerna.
* Säkerställa utarbetande och kundgodkännande av teststrategin och testplanen.
* Samarbeta och hantera buggfixar och möten om dem.
* Utarbetande av och deltagande i PRA.
* Säkerställa att testningen genomförs enligt tidsplanen.
* Upprättande av testrapporter och validering av rapporterade fel/krav.


**Kompetens och sakkunskap**
 Vi föreställer oss att vår nya kollega har en relevant längre utbildning, är ISTQB Advanced Test Manager och har minst 5 års erfarenhet av test management från liknande leveranser av kritisk programvara. Dessutom förväntar vi oss att du:
   

  

* har kunskap om de IT-verktyg som används vid kravhantering, testning och testplanering
* arbetar på ett strukturerat och proaktivt sätt för att förutsäga och minska potentiella avvikelser från planen
* säkerställer transparens och ärlighet i kommunikationen och relationen mellan kund och kollegor
* talar engelska och svenska flytande (förståelse för danska är meriterande).


 Du kommer att ha din arbetsplats på vårt kontor i Stockholm, men i början av din anställning kan du förvänta dig att få resa till Systematics huvudkontor i Århus (DK) omkring en gång varannan månad. Mycket av ditt arbete kommer i vardagen att ske hos våra kunder på deras anläggningar.
   

  

**Sluta aldrig att utvecklas**
 Systematic är internationellt och sätter människan i fokus. Tillsammans skriver vi intelligent och innovativ kod för att driva utvecklingen framåt och förbättra liv, leverera den till våra många kunder och stödja dem i användningen av den. Vi utvecklar IT-lösningar som gör en verklig skillnad där det verkligen spelar roll. Det är därför vi aldrig slutar att utvecklas Här har vi åtagit oss att vara mer än bara en arbetsplats – Systematic är en gemenskap där professionalism möter personlig kontakt och ger en känsla av tillhörighet och stolthet.
   

  

**Påbörja din utveckling här**
 Vi utvärderar ansökningar löpande, då vi vill tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt. Så klicka på ”APPLY NOW” och skicka oss ditt CV idag. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten kan kontakta oss på 89 43 20 00 och fråga efter Martin Lyngsø Rea, chef, CIS. Martin kommer att finnas tillgänglig från och med 19 augusti, på grund av föräldraledighet.
   

  

 Get in touch
   

  

 Sofie Heiner Emborg
   

  

 Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

title: Senior Paid Social specialist
description:
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.* 




*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as Disney, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Essity, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, Nomad Foods, Lactalis, Midsona, Renault and many more.* 




  





*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.* 




  





***Please note that due to the holiday season, you may experience longer response times and delays between Midsummer and mid-August.***




  





**Job Description** 




  





 We are currently looking for a Senior Paid Social specialist to join our team. In this role, you will work alongside project managers and digital planners to execute impactful campaigns across various social media channels, including Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, Pinterest, and others. Your responsibilities will include ongoing social media purchasing, from strategizing and providing recommendations to setting up campaigns, optimizing them, analyzing their performance, and reporting on them. You will also be responsible for dynamic advertising and social commerce.
 



  





 As a Senior Paid Social specialist, your responsibilities will include the following:
 



  





 • Developing and implementing strategies across social media platforms
 



 • Designing dynamic campaign strategies for our clients
 



 • Creating tactical and dynamic campaign recommendations for paid social media
 



 • Planning, purchasing, optimizing, and continually reporting on social media campaigns, primarily for larger global accounts
 



 • Managing campaigns using self-service tools for purchasing, optimization, and campaign management
 



 • Building and maintaining dynamic feeds
 



 • Analyzing and evaluating campaign results based on predefined goals
 



 • Performing various administration tasks related to campaigns and customer work
 



  





**Qualifications** 




  





 Skills and qualifications required for this position include:
 



  




* Academic or relevant post-secondary education in marketing.
* Proven experience in paid social media, whether on the agency or client side.
* A customer-focused approach, ensuring that ad campaigns align with the target audience's needs and interests.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills for client interaction, reporting, and team collaboration.
* A natural curiosity to stay updated on social media trends and industry changes.
* The ability to identify issues with ad campaigns and recommend solutions promptly.
* A collaborative mindset, working effectively with a team, clients, and other marketing professionals.
* Proficiency in the Smartly platform is a plus.



  





**Additional Information** 




  





 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
 


* **Career Opportunities**



 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
 


* **Personal and Professional Learning**



 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
 


* **Flexible Ways of Working**



 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
 


* **Work Your World**



 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
 


* **Mental Health**



 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
 


* **Benefits**



 Generous benefit package.
 



  





***Please note that due to the holiday season, you may experience longer response times and delays between Midsummer and mid-August.***

title: Teknikspecialist fristående miljöer, polisens specialistverksamhet
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

*Vill du arbeta nära polisens nischade verksamheter? Som anställd på IT-avdelningen är du delaktig i ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag med många spännande verksamhetsområden och en möjlighet att göra skillnad på riktigt. Våra system används i polisernas vardag dygnet runt, året runt. Från att ha säker gränsövervakning till att färdigställa en förundersökning inför en rättegång. Polismyndighetens IT-avdelning har drygt 1200 anställda som tillsammans sköter drift, underhåll och utveckling av IT-stödet till myndighetens olika verksamhetsområden.*
 Vår gruppering arbetar med Polismyndighetens tekniska förmågor som bidrar i arbetet mot grov organiserad brottslighet och stöttar de specialistverksamheter som finns i myndigheten. I sin natur omfattas det dagliga arbetet inte bara av sekretess utan även säkerhetsskydd, samtidigt som vi jobbar mycket nära verksamheten.
   

  

 Även om gruppen har helhetsansvaret för våra lösningar, så är vi beroende av och samarbetar med flera delar av IT-avdelningen, vilket gör att du kommer ha daglig kontakt med ett flertal andra grupper.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som teknikspecialist kommer du att vara med och stärka upp den tekniska kompetensen för ett flertal fristående miljöer som är under framtagande eller redan i drift. Dessa miljöer, med inneboende system, kommer vara avgörande för att specialistverksamheter inom Polismyndigheten ska kunna avancera gentemot grov organiserad brottslighet. Vi jobbar nära den polisiära verksamheten, både slutanvändare och ledning, och hjälper dem att utveckla sin spetsförmåga genom ett utbyte av behov och tekniska lösningar. I arbetet ingår att skapa sig en god förståelse för verksamhetens behov och förutsättningar för att kunna omsätta det till effektiva tekniska lösningar, samtidigt som vi inte ger avkall på säkerheten.
   

  

 Vi har en spännande bredd på våra lösningar då vi hanterar både hård- och mjukvara samt är involverade genom hela infrastrukturen från nätverk och server till applikation hos slutanvändare. Dessutom är vi delaktiga över hela livscykeln från installation och utveckling till drift, utbildning och support. I det dagliga arbetet kommer stort fokus ligga på administrationen av de fristående miljöerna, t.ex. genom serveradministration, användarhantering och hantering av klientutrustning.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom IT-området alternativt motsvarande förvärvad erfarenhet/utbildning som Polismyndigheten bedömer likvärdig.
* Minst fem års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet som är relevant för tjänsten
* Erfarenhet av att administrera både fysiska och virtuella miljöer, t.ex. genom användarhantering, serveradministration eller installation av programvara
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som i skrift.


 Anställningen kräver svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Det är meriterande om du även har djupare erfarenhet av:**
* Signalskydd, säkerhetsskydd
* Autonoma miljöer
* Fristående, härdad klientutrustning
* Administration av Windows- och/eller Linux-miljöer
* Administration av Active Directory
* Nätverk och infrastruktur
* Servrar och datahall
* Informationssäkerhet
* Utveckling/programmering av applikationer


**Personliga egenskaper:**
 Vi söker dig som kombinerar hög integritet med att vara lösningsorienterad. Då rollen innebär många kontaktytor ser vi det som en självklarhet att du samverkar och kommunicerar med andra på ett smidigt sätt för att nå gemensamma mål. Som teknikspecialist kan du vara involverad i olika typer av uppdrag, vilket innebär att du gillar att utmanas i ditt tänk och du är inte rädd att kavla upp ärmarna och bidra både i det stora och lilla. Vidare ser vi att du är någon som är ansvarstagande, noggrann, driven och tar egna initiativ.
   

  

 Då vårt arbete omfattas av strikta säkerhetskrav kommer stor vikt läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att ta kontakt via, tfn 010-564 11 57
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn: 010-563 87 10
   

  

 SACO, nås via Polisens växel tfn: 114 14
   

  

 SEKO Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn: 010-561 66 27
   

  

 ST, nås via Polisens växel tfn: 114 14
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 I denna rekrytering görs löpande urval.
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm, Kungsholmen
   

  

 Arbetstid: Heltid, Flextid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Teknikspecialist
   

  

**Från och med maj 2024 använder vi inte personligt brev i våra rekryterings-processer. Vi ber dig istället att bifoga ditt CV där du tydligt beskriver på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter kopplat till aktuell rekrytering.**
 Du kan se den kompletta kravprofilen i jobbannonsen.
   

  

**Utöver CV behöver du även besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor som en del av din ansökan. Dessa frågor utgår från aktuell kravprofil och ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.**
 Länk till enkäten (pdf, 311 kB)
   

  

 Spara ner urvalsenkäten och bifoga den i mailet med din ansökan/ditt CV. Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället. De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och besvarade urvalsfrågor via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se senast den 16 september 2024.** 
 Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A389.933/2024 i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

***Polismyndigheten***
***Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen***
***Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för** 
**rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.***
***Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet.***
***Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!***
***Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.***

title: SAP Delivery Excellence Consultant
description:
**SAP Delivery (Senior) Manager**
 Do you have a passion for innovation and delivering new SAP technologies to make a positive impact in your client’s business? Are you inspired by working with the best companies in their industries? Do you want a role that provides you with a sense of purpose and satisfaction? Then join Accenture and build a rewarding career improving the way the world works and lives, as you help clients innovate with leading SAP technologies.
   

  

**Your role**
 The Delivery Manager is responsible for the successful and profitable delivery of Accenture’s major SAP projects. You will be expected to lead and drive all aspects of a project or program: from blueprint to design, build, test and post-go-live-support. Connecting with our clients, you will define scope and plan for an implementation. Using your in-depth SAP expertise, you will coach and manage your team on designing and delivering solutions that fit our clients’ requirements as well as plan and budget. As you will be part of an international, multi-disciplinary team, you will use your people skills to cooperate closely with Accenture colleagues in onshore and offshore locations across the globe. Your ability to build strong relationships with client stakeholders, will help you to deliver and create future value.
   

  

 Next to focusing on delivery, you will also get the opportunity to develop new business development at (new) clients and contribute to the Accenture SAP Business Group in terms of knowledge or asset development.
   

  

**Your team**
 Accenture Technology leverages design thinking, industry insights and the latest digital methodologies to help clients innovate, grow and improve their businesses. Our expertise, capabilities and experience mean that our clients (including some of the biggest brands in the world) trust us to find the right solutions for their needs.
   

  

 Together with our talented international colleagues, we focus on connecting the needs of businesses with the new possibilities that come with technological progress. Because that's where the real challenges are: inventing and testing things that have never been tried before, getting new applications ready for roll-out, and ultimately guiding clients to select and implement the right technologies to transform their businesses.
   

  

**Your background**
- Master or bachelor’s degree

- Minimum of 8 years SAP experience, in several disciplines/functional areas

- Minimum of 8 years experience as a Project manager

- Experience in a consulting environment

- Experience with different project management methods (Waterfall, Agile)

- Proven experience in multiple phases of the delivery lifecycle

- Outspoken and passionate about delivering successful programs that exceed business objectives and drive business success for our customers

- Focused on creating re-usable solutions

- Must have the highest level of leadership and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex solutions and ideas. Excellent presentation skills

- Proficiency in English and Danish/Swedish/Norwegian/Finnish

**What We Offer**
 We have fun at work, and we focus on good work-life balance. We work across Nordics, and we support and root for one another. We cherish a psychologically safe environment where everyone´s allowed to be their true selves.
   

  

  

- Truly competitive salary terms, bonus program, (pension), health insurance, (employee stock purchase program) and fringe benefits

- Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine free time and family life with work. We offer active support for mental health.

- Personal Mentor to guide your career within Accenture´s global possibilities

- Market-leading expertise and great learning opportunities

**Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Does this appeal to you?**
 If so, we really wish to hear from you! (We need people who can challenge conventional wisdom, offer unique perspectives, and contribute with innovative solutions.)
   

  

*If you are interested to learn more about Accenture´s recruitment process, great! We have gathered more info for you* 
*here.*
 Please note that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Sourcing Manager
description:
**ValueOne is looking for an experienced and result driven Sourcing Manager Product Development with excellent knowledge in end-to-end Supply Chain for a consultant assignment at a manufacturing company in Stockholm. The assignment must be filled as soon as possible and will transition to permanent employment after completion of the assignment.** 




  





***ValueOne***
*are specialists in supply chain management, purchasing and logistics. We offer our customers services in three business areas: interim logistics and procurement consultants, recruitment of buyers and logisticians, as well as development of our customers’ supply chain operations in terms of strategies, models, methods, processes, structure, and competence.* 




*We can offer a variety of assignments at all levels within Supply Chain Management. As a consultant at ValueOne, you are part of a professional and enterprising team consisting of the leading consultants in purchasing and logistics. If you choose to join our team, you are offered:* 




*A market salary, which you can influence yourself.Occupational pension.Health and care insurance.Health care allowance.Personal coaching and career advice.Network meetings with competent colleagues and Supply Chain professionals through recurring events and lectures.Competence development through world-leading individually tailored education and courses in Supply Chain thanks to our partnership with CIPS (www.cips.org).* 
**The role** 




 The Sourcing Manager Product Development is accountable for implementing and driving the sourcing strategy within specific areas such as Chassis, Seat or Electronics. The responsibility includes meeting targets and KPIs, utilizing preferred suppliers, introducing new suppliers, managing risks and costs, ensuring quality and compliance, setting strategy direction, controlling spend, and conducting market benchmarking analysis. You oversee supplier management throughout projects, develop sourcing strategies, establish supplier partnerships and agreements.
 



  





 Main tasks:
 


* Develop and implement platform sourcing strategy to meet customer needs and enhance market competitiveness.
* Manage supplier relationships to achieve quality, delivery, and cost goals throughout development.
* Optimize end-to-end supply chain from supplier selection to production unit delivery.
* Negotiate commercial terms and agreements for optimal value.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to align sourcing strategies with business objectives.
* Lead cross-functional teams for cost savings, supplier performance improvement, and risk mitigation.
* Identify new suppliers and technologies to enhance platform performance and reduce costs.
* Oversee logistics for timely component delivery to project designers.
* Develop and implement sourcing concepts and supplier scouting.
* Create supply chain definitions and manage associated risks.
* Define and coordinate production plans with R&D.
* Collaborate to refine supply chain requirements with R&D and product management.
* Ensure alignment of product ramp-up plans with management and R&D.
* Coordinate supplier and production ramp-up plans.



  





**Experience and competencies** 




 The ideal candidate for this position should possess a Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, engineering, business or economics, or equivalent experience in strategic sourcing or similar roles. You should have excellent knowledge of end-to-end supply chain processes, proficiency in business analysis including cost breakdown analysis, and strong negotiation and contract management skills. Familiarity with lean concepts, engineering principles, and IS/IT systems is desirable. Previous experience in sourcing, purchasing, or supply chain roles is preferred, with an engineering or technical background being advantageous.
 



 Effective relationship management, communication, and negotiation skills are essential, along with analytical abilities to evaluate supplier performance and financial acumen to assess total costs. The candidate should thrive in pressure situations, demonstrate logical thinking, and excel in managing multiple projects simultaneously. You should be results-oriented, proactive in finding solutions, and possess excellent business English proficiency. A high degree of understanding complex problems and the ability to drive strategic initiatives independently are also necessary for this role.
 



  





**Application** 




 We look forward to receiving your application. Feel free to contact Lotta Muth at +46 73 388 66 07 or 010 332 29 20 with any questions regarding the listed position. Please note that to apply for this position you need to be an EU citizen or have a valid Swedish working permit.

title: Senior Fund Accountant till Permian
description:
Permian fortsätter att växa och vi söker nu en driven Senior Fund Accountant till vårt team i Stockholm. Har du ett intresse för Private Equity-branschen och vill bredda din kunskap inom finansbranschen med fokus på alternativa investeringsfonder? Kanske jobbar du på en mer traditionell och större redovisningsbyrå idag och vill byta till en spännande och händelserik bransch och ett bolag i tillväxt? Då kan denna roll vara din nästa utmaning!
 



  





 Vi på Permian söker dig som vill ta ansvar för redovisning, skatt och rapportering, samt bidra till utveckling och effektivisering av våra processer. Tillsammans med skickliga kollegor och intressanta kunder kommer du att bidra till vår framgång och fortsatta tillväxt.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Senior Fund Accountant hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att leverera högkvalitativa redovisningstjänster till våra kunder.
 



  





 Du kommer att:
 


* Hanterar redovisning, skatt och rapportering för Permians kunder
* Upprätta månads-, kvartals- och årsbokslut
* Upprätta årsredovisningar
* Upprätta moms- och inkomstdeklarationer
* Hantera redovisning av investeringar, eget kapital-transaktioner, vinstutdelningar och emissioner
* Utbilda och coacha mer juniora redovisningskonsulter
* Driva effektivisering och förbättring av processer
* Få djupgående inblick i kundernas verksamheter, inklusive relevanta avtal och tillämpliga lagar och regler
* Samarbeta och vara en sparringpartner för kollegor och kunder inom redovisning, skatt och finansiell rapportering



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




  





 Vi tror att du har:
 


* En magister- eller kandidatexamen i ekonomi, redovisning eller finans
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete med redovisning, gärna inom fondbranschen
* Erfarenhet av redovisningsstandarder (K2 och K3) samt praktisk erfarenhet av bokslut, moms och skatt
* Erfarenhet av att ge professionell kundservice
* Erfarenhet av koncernredovisning är ett plus
* Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi värdesätter strukturerade och processdrivna medarbetare som trivs med att hantera flera projekt parallellt. Har du ett systemintresse och vilja att ständigt effektivisera ditt arbete ser vi det som mycket positivt. Självklart har du ett starkt kundfokus och gillar att arbeta i team!
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi** 




 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att arbeta med engagerade och kompetenta kollegor. Hos oss får du chansen att utvecklas och växa i din roll, samtidigt som du bidrar till våra kunders framgång. Du får en unik möjlighet att bredda din kunskap inom finansbranschen, med fokus på alternativa investeringsfonder, i ett bolag med stark tillväxt. Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling genom bla både interna och externa utbildningar. Som senior finns också goda utvecklingsmöjligheter att ta en manager roll på relativt kort sikt. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler mitt i city nära centralen och erbjuder hybridarbete.
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Permian är en snabbväxande och innovativ ledande nordisk fondadministratör med kontor i centrala Oslo och Stockholm. Permiangruppen arbetar med investeringsbolag, riskkapitalfonder och fondförvaltare som tillsammans idag har 200 mdkr under förvaltning fördelade på ett ungefär hundra fonder och investeringsbolag. Som specialist inom fondadministration erbjuder Permian ett brett utbud av experttjänster till nordiska Venture-, Private Equity- och riskkapitalbolag, bl.a. rådgivning, fondadministration, fondförvaltnings-, förvaringsinstitut- och redovisningstjänster. Målsättningen är att minska de administrativa bördorna för kunderna med expertis, IT verktyg och effektivitet.
 



 Företaget grundades i Oslo för 10 år sedan och idag är vi 100 personer på plats i Stockholm och Oslo.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering har Permian valt att samarbeta med SJR. För mer information är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sara Borgeström på sara.borgestrom@sjr.se. Notera att vi tyvärr inte tar emot ansökningshandlingar via e-post.
 



  





 Urval och intervjuer kommer att starta i mitten på augusti.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: German Speaking Sustainability Platform Analyst
description:
*Do you want to be part of a leading Nordic sustainability scaleup whilst contributing to the global corporate sustainability transition? Position Green is in a strong scaleup phase and we are looking for new amazing talents to join our Customer Success team.*
**About Position Green**
 Position Green is a leading pure play sustainability partner with a mission to revolutionise how businesses integrate sustainability. Through our SaaS software for data management, strategic advisory and e-learning services, Position Green’s offering makes sustainability actionable and measurable, supporting businesses to fast-track their sustainability transformation whilst also strengthening their competitiveness and long-term survival. We come from the Nordics but we operate across the globe in supporting our customers to navigate and succeed in corporate sustainability.
   

  

 We are excited to offer the opportunity to be part of our journey in the role of Sustainability Platform Manager, working in a discipline with a crucial impact on Position Green’s business growth.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Sustainability Platform Analyst is responsible for continuously developing the customers’ measure structure in Position Green Platform in line with their needs, making sure that the structure is quality assured and follows the platform’s development. You´ll have a producing role and are an expert on how our customers' needs are best built up in our platform. You work both close to the product and the customer, and there will be great development opportunities when you join the company at an early stage. Reporting to our CS Team lead, you will be part of a team full of knowledge, ambition and fun. There will also be great development opportunities when you join the company at an early stage.
   

  

**As a Sustainability Platform Analyst, you will mainly:**
* Be an expert in our platform and run meetings with the customers linked to their setup
* Continuously develop a measure structure in Position Green that corresponds to the customers' needs in collaboration with the Sustainability Platform Manager
* Stay up to date on new features in Position Green to secure that the customer gets the most value out of our platform
* Ensure a smooth customer journey


**What are we looking for?**
* You have a degree (BSc minimum) within a relevant field, such as environment, engineering and/or technology
* Basic programming skills - acquired through academics or professional experience
* Knowledge within calculations of greenhouse gas emissions and emission factors
* Knowledge within sustainability reporting according to GRI, CDP and TCFD
* Knowledge within Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Protocol and Science Based Targets
* You're fluent in English and German, both written and spoken


 To thrive in this role, we believe that you are used to being responsible for your own projects and see the importance of your delivery meeting the customers' needs. You are meticulous and have a deeper technical understanding as well as a great interest in working with digital products.
   

  

 As a person, you have a positive attitude and we believe that you are curious and have a good sense of humor. You are a doer with sharp eye for details as well as truly understanding and delivering according to the customer's needs. You look forward to working in a growing team and is driven by contributing to a positive change.
   

  

**Location**
 We believe that you are based in the greater Stockholm or Malmö region and can be in the office 3 days a week, with the possibility to work remotely when it is more suitable for you and your work schedule.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 As our new colleague here at Position Green you get to be an important part of a fast-paced and fun scale up environment. We offer you a great opportunity to grow as a person as well as in your career. You get to work in a company where you can have great impact and drive sustainable transformation in business and organisations.
   

  

 You’ll get fair compensation and benefits, including:
   

  

* Wellness allowance of 5 000 SEK/year
* 30 vacation days + 5 extra PG days
* Flexible working hours and hybrid work option


**What's next?**
 If this sounds like a great opportunity for you, we will be happy to receive your CV. In this recruitment, great importance is placed on personal suitability.
   

  

 We will be reviewing applications on a continuous basis and looking forward to your application.
   

  

* Position Green Group is the Nordic leader in sustainability software and consulting.
* Supports 500+ customers worldwide.
* 300+ employees with expertise within strategy, communication, software development, environmental studies, engineering and social sciences.
* Awarded and recognized as one of the leading tech scaleups in the Nordics by Techarenan, Deloitte, Norrsken Impact Summit, Cleantech Scandinavia and Breakit.

title: CMC RA Manager
description:
QRIOS Life Science is now looking for a CMC RA Manager for a consultant assignment at AstraZeneca.
   

  

 At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. If you are swift to action, confident to lead, willing to collaborate, and curious about what science can do, then you’re our kind of person.
   

  

 Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls Regulatory Affairs (CMC RA)
   

  

 Our Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Control (CMC) Regulatory Affairs function spans across the product lifecycle and is responsible for the regulatory strategy relating to the development, manufacture and testing of all of our medicines.
   

  

 With our expertise we interpret, anticipate and craft global Health Authority expectations to build insightful CMC and Device Regulatory Strategies.
   

  

 We are the bridge between our R&D functions, Operations sites, Quality and Global Supply Teams in helping safe, effective medicines reach the right patient at the right times. We manage the timely preparation and delivery of CMC contributions to the regulatory submissions linked to medicinal products throughout the product lifecycle; including Clinical Trial Applications (CTAs), Marketing Authorisation Applications (MAAs) and all post approval activities improving the reliability and value of business critical Supply Chain changes to the AZ organization by supplying the regulatory context, intelligence and mentorship for robust approval and change management.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for a Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls Regulatory Affairs (CMC RA) Manager to join us in Gärtuna, with the flexibility to work remotely for up to 2 days a week.
   

  

 Being a CMC RA Manager means that you will effectively manage the production of CMC documentation for designated product ranges to deliver against the needs of both the AZ business and the patients for internally and externally manufactured products. You will project manage global CMC regulatory submissions ensuring that project activities and documentation are delivered to the required standards.
   

  

 As a CMC RA Manager you will also contribute to and own the regulatory CMC components of business-related projects, applying effective levels of interactive communication with collaborators and project team members to ensure that relevant timelines and regulatory commitments are appropriately communicated. The accountabilities also include responsibility for change management as assigned and to ensure the takeaways from own projects are shared with other co-workers/within the function.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Manage/Lead assigned projects; define and agree regulatory submission strategy, coordinate cross-functional preparation of submission content and complete data assessments to ensure the authored regulatory CMC contributions are in line with AstraZeneca and Health Authority requirements throughout product lifecycle stages
   

  

 Leverage regulatory intelligence to optimise submission content, employing quality risk management as appropriate
   

  

 Maintain regulatory databases related to submissions
   

  

 Capture and communicate Health Authority approval status
   

  

 Continually evolve and develop the organisation’s regulatory expertise; through proactive recording and communication of regulatory insights gained via Health Authority interactions
   

  

 Build and maintain good relationships with internal and external partners to facilitate regulatory execution and delivery
   

  

 Contribute to business process optimization activities, removing waste and improving efficiency
   

  

 Apply GxP principles according to the stage of product lifecycle
   

  

**Your profile**
 Crucial for the role:
   

  

 – Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a scientific subject area
   

  

 – Experience in a biopharmaceutical (or related) manufacturing, technical or regulatory environment
   

  

 – Awareness of CMC considerations and how they apply in a regulatory environment
   

  

 – Project management expertise with the ability to plan, coordinate sophisticated programs of work and adapt to changing situations to ensure on time delivery
   

  

 – Effective communication (written and oral) and partner leadership skills
   

  

 – IT Skills
   

  

 Desirable for the role:
   

  

 – Detailed understanding of current regulatory CMC requirements and the CMC contributions to clinical and/or commercial regulatory dossiers
   

  

 – Knowledge of the drug development and marketing application processes for pharmaceutical products
   

  

 – Direct/indirect Regulatory Affairs CMC experience with clinical (IND & IMPD) or marketing application (NDA or BLA) submissions for synthetics and/or biologic and biotechnology derived products
   

  

 – Understanding of regulations and guidance governing the manufacture of pharmaceutical products
   

  

 – Demonstrated research skills in understanding, interpreting and applying regulations or guidance from external sources; including industry bodies and national competent authorities
   

  

 – Lean capabilities
   

  

 – Understanding and application of appropriate risk management
   

  

 – Proactive in identifying and acting on opportunities to drive operational improvements
   

  

**About The Organisation**
 QRIOS Life Science can offer several opportunities for skilled people with a background in biochemistry, chemical engineering or science. We work with Sweden’s leading pharmaceutical and life science companies. So whether you’re interested in research, regulatory affairs, quality assurance, environmental and quality control, sales and marketing, or just want a career change, we have the job for you.
   

  

 Working as a consultant suits whoever wants to get a lot of experience in a short period of time. We offer you the chance to work with well-known brands at renowned companies where you can develop your skills. If you’re looking for a world of exciting assignments and new contacts, you’ll like being a consultant.
   

  

 About Astra Zeneca:
   

  

 AstraZeneca is a major international healthcare company engaged in the research, development, manufacture and marketing of prescription pharmaceuticals and the supply of healthcare services. But we are more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies – at AstraZeneca, we are proud to have a unique culture that inspires innovation and collaboration. Here, employees are empowered to express diverse perspectives – and are made to feel valued, energized and rewarded for their ideas and creativity.
   

  

**Fakta**
* Bransch


 Life Science
   

  

* Stad Södertälje
* Anställningsform Tillsvidareanställning
* Uppdragstyp Heltid
* Sista ansökningsdag 2024-08-22
* Referensnummer 1128


**Har du frågor?**
 Hanna Peterson
   

  

 hanna.peterson@qrios.se

title: MAC Cosmetics - Multi Counter Manager - Ahlens City, Stockholm
description:
Are you ready to manage multiple brands, and take it to greater heights? Do you have what it takes to drive effective multibrand customer experiences?
   

  

 Then this could be an opportunity of a lifetime.
   

  

***Estée Lauder Companies at a glance***
 The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MAC, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD BEAUTY, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, and the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD.
   

  

**The role**
 As a Multi Counter Manager, you will be responsible for all areas in the business. From handling multiple counters of different brands to achieving sales targets, you will as well ensure that customers are receiving the best in-store experience and be responsible for leading and developing a team of talented sales advisors to their full potential.
   

  

 You will be reporting to your direct District Manager.
   

  

 The position is permanent and full-time, based in Stockholm Åhléns City. The potential start date will be October 1st.
   

  

**More specifically, you will work with**
* Store Operations - With great operations come great results.
* Maintain and set an example of outstanding customer service in a positive and inspiring atmosphere
* Track of sales, monitor KPI’s and communication of business results
* Follow the business trends and create action plans to generate incremental sales
* Maintain and monitor inventory levels
* Create and plan event strategies for the fiscal year in accordance with the product and collection launches and key shopping moments
* Optimize the store’s schedule according to peak hours
* Maintain excellent visual merchandizing and hygiene standards at all times
* People Management - Our colleagues are the heart of the store.
* Be responsible for the full cycle of recruitment
* Support and develop the team in selling techniques and product knowledge to ensure that teams consistently welcome, inspire and personalize each experience
* Continually conduct performance discussions and provide constant feedback to ensure positive results
* Proactively manage poor performance, addressing attendance or conduct issues in line with brand expectations, utilizing the appropriate procedures and support
* Build a good work environment ensuring that the employees are thriving and take action in case of conflicts


**Qualifications**
**You are the perfect fit if you:**
* Have a minimum of high school diploma or have a certificate from a make-up school
* Have +3 years of working experience in retail sales preferably within the beauty sector, with management experience
* Are business-minded and aligned with KPI's set by the company
* Have a proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets and for delivering exceptional customer experience
* Have strong multitasking skills and can oversee multibrands
* Have excellent communication, organisation, delegation and time management skills
* Are proficient in a Nordic language and in English both in speaking and in writing
* Are proficient in Microsoft Office tools such as Outlook, Excel and Word and have experience with POS systems
* Are able to work retail hours including days, nights, week-ends and during special events
* Are familiar with Social Media platforms such as TikTok and Instagram


**Your Personality**
* You are reliable, positive and proactive
* You have strong leadership skills and lead people by example
* You are result-oriented and goal driven
* Seeing someone win makes you proud - You value your team's development and are always willing to help when someone needs an extra hand
* You are not afraid of making mistakes and being part of the solution
* You see change as an opportunity, and can quickly adapt to it


**What We Offer**
* Working for the Estée Lauder Companies means that you will be part of the global leader's journey in Prestige Beauty
* Competitive salary including a bonus opportunity
* Discounts on part of the company's product portfolio
* Great training and development programs on a professional and personal note and the opportunity to move to other markets
* Want to make a difference at work? We engage our colleagues by contributing to greater causes and giving back to the community through social initiatives


**Inclusion, Diversity & Equity in the core of everything we do:**
 Estee Lauder Companies is an equal opportunities employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.
   

  

**Next Steps**
 You will have to apply through our Career Portal and we will get in touch with you directly if your profile could be a good fit. The deadline to apply is August 18th
   

  

 The expected start date will be October 1st.
   

  

 As part of the recruitment process, you will receive a link to complete a video interview stating your motivation for this job.
   

  

 We are looking forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Job:** 
 Retail - Store
   

  

**Primary Location:** 
 Europe, Middle East, Africa-SE-AB-
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Standard
   

  

**Schedule:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Shift:** 
 Variable
   

  

**Job Number:** 
 2410520

title: Kreditförvaltare till AMF
description:
Är du en erfaren Kreditförvaltare med gedigen kunskap inom företagsanalys som söker nya utmaningar?
 



  





 AMF Fonder letar efter en etablerad professionell Kreditförvaltare som vill ta nästa steg i karriären, med ansvar för ett eget riskmandat i en dynamisk och utvecklande förvaltningsmiljö.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Kreditförvaltare kommer du, tillsammans med en annan kollega, att ansvara för förvaltningen av kreditobligationer inom livbolaget och dess tillhörande mandat. Kreditförvaltningen sker i huvudsak i kreditobligationer denominerade i SEK, EUR samt USD. I rollen ingår även ett ansvar för att fortsätta utveckla kreditförvaltningen inom bolaget tillsammans med kollegorna.
 



 Du kommer att arbeta nära med övriga förvaltare på avdelningen och förväntas kunna agera som backup för förvaltningen av statspappersportföljen, räntefonderna samt AMF:s valutahantering.
 



 Ränteavdelningen genomför regelbundna strategimöten där ekonomisk statistik, marknadsrörelser, positioner, avkastning och framtida strategier diskuteras. Som Kreditförvaltare förväntas du, tillsammans med övriga kollegor, att delta aktivt och bidra i dessa möten.
 



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som innehar en civilekonomexamen med inriktning mot finans eller nationalekonomi, och som har lång erfarenhet av förvaltning av kreditobligationer. En bakgrund som kreditanalytiker är önskvärd, och du har ett genuint intresse för de finansiella marknaderna. Din erfarenhet av handel och positionstagande inom räntebärande tillgångar är omfattande. Det är meriterande med kunskap inom hållbarhetsfrågor kopplat till obligationsinvesteringar samt erfarenhet av IT-system i frontofficemiljö, såsom Bloomberg AIM/PORT.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Till rollen söker vi dig som är både resultatorienterad samt analytiskt och strukturerat lagd. Du har lätt för att samarbeta i ett team och behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i såväl tal som skrift. Eftersom avdelningen består av relativt få personer är det viktigt att du är prestigelös, en lagspelare, utåtriktad, kommunikativ och förtroendeingivande. Rollen som Kreditförvaltare kräver i stor utsträckning närvaro på kontoret.
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 AMF ligger mitt i centrala Stockholm och vi är idag cirka 450 medarbetare i koncernen. AMF är tjänstepensionsbolaget med enkla och trygga tjänstepensionslösningar. Vi ägs av LO och Svenskt Näringsliv och drivs enligt ömsesidiga principer. Det innebär att den vinst vi skapar oavkortat går tillbaka till våra kunder. Vår vision är att vara bäst i Sverige på pensionen från jobbet. Våra kunder ska få den bästa pensionsprodukten, med god avkastning till en låg avgift. Vi drivs av ett stort engagemang för våra kunder och en stolthet för vårt uppdrag. Vi lever enligt våra värdeord; enkel, trygg och mänsklig. Därför tycker vi att det är viktigt att visa varandra respekt och öppenhet på jobbet. Vi jobbar också för ett tydligt ledarskap, jämlikhet och mångfald genom rätten att få vara sig själv. Vi vill att alla ska känna arbetsglädje och trivas hos oss.
 



  





 Dotterbolaget AMF Fonder förvaltar 14 fonder samt ansvarar för portföljförvaltningen av AMF Tjänstepensions placeringstillgångar. Det förvaltade kapitalet uppgår till över 800 Mdr SEK. Placeringar sker i aktier, fastigheter, alternativa placeringar och räntebärande tillgångar. AMF är en av de största ägarna på Stockholmsbörsen, och en av Sveriges största investerare i fastigheter och reala tillgångar. AMF gör även investeringar i onoterade aktier och alternativa krediter. Kapitalförvaltningen består av drygt 60 personer som sitter tillsammans på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar AMF Fonder med SJR Executive Search. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig Seniorkonsult Anders Dareholt på 070-471 59 09 eller Researchkonsult Emelie Jorland på 072-066 02 98. Urval och intervjuer kommer att påbörjas efter semestrarna i slutet av augusti/början av september. Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post eller meddelande på LinkedIn. Alla ansökningar och kontakter hanteras konfidentiellt.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: CMC RA Manager to AztraZeneca

 Our Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Control (CMC) Regulatory Affairs function spans across the product lifecycle and is responsible for the regulatory strategy relating to the development, manufacture and testing of all of our medicines.
   

  

 With our expertise we interpret, anticipate and craft global Health Authority expectations to build insightful CMC and Device Regulatory Strategies.
   

  

 We are the bridge between our R&D functions, Operations sites, Quality and Global Supply Teams in helping safe, effective medicines reach the right patient at the right times. We manage the timely preparation and delivery of CMC contributions to the regulatory submissions linked to medicinal products throughout the product lifecycle; including Clinical Trial Applications (CTAs), Marketing Authorisation Applications (MAAs) and all post approval activities improving the reliability and value of business critical Supply Chain changes to the AZ organization by supplying the regulatory context, intelligence and mentorship for robust approval and change management.
   

  

 This is an consulting assignment via Adecco and is set to start as soon as possible and is a one (1) year assignment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**

 Being a CMC RA Manager means that you will effectively manage the production of CMC documentation for designated product ranges to deliver against the needs of both the AZ business and the patients for internally and externally manufactured products. You will project manage global CMC regulatory submissions ensuring that project activities and documentation are delivered to the required standards.
   

  

 As a CMC RA Manager you will also contribute to and own the regulatory CMC components of business-related projects, applying effective levels of interactive communication with collaborators and project team members to ensure that relevant timelines and regulatory commitments are appropriately communicated. **Responsibilities:**
 Manage/Lead assigned projects; define and agree regulatory submission strategy, coordinate cross-functional preparation of submission content and complete data assessments to ensure the authored regulatory CMC contributions are in line with AstraZeneca and Health Authority requirements throughout product lifecycle stages
   

  

 Leverage regulatory intelligence to optimise submission content, employing quality risk management as appropriate Maintain regulatory databases related to submissions Capture and communicate Health Authority approval status Continually evolve and develop the organisation’s regulatory expertise; through proactive recording and communication of regulatory insights gained via Health Authority interactions Build and maintain good relationships with internal and external partners to facilitate regulatory execution and delivery Contribute to business process optimization activities, removing waste and improving efficiency Apply GxP principles according to the stage of product lifecycle

 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please feel free to contact the responsible recruiter: accsverige@adecco.se
   

  

 For questions regarding registration, please contact support at info@adecco.se.
