title: Manager Fund Accounting till Permian
description:
Har du ett intresse för Private Equity-branschen? Önskar du bredda din kunskap inom finansbranschen, med fokus på alternativa investeringsfonder? Söker du en roll där du får jobba kundnära och coacha medarbetare? Kanske jobbar du på en mer traditionell och större redovisningsbyrå idag och vill byta till en spännande och händelserik bransch och ett bolag i tillväxt? Då kan rollen som Fund Accounting Manager på Permian, en ledande nordisk fondadministratör, vara din nästa utmaning!
 



  





 Vi på Permian söker dig som vill ta ansvar för kundrelationer, utveckla och effektivisera rutiner samt säkerställa högsta kvalitet i vår rapportering och kommunikation. Tillsammans med skickliga kollegor och intressanta kunder kommer du att bidra till vår framgång och fortsatta tillväxt.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




  





 Som Fund Accounting Manager hos oss kommer du att ansvara för att leverera högkvalitativa redovisningstjänster till våra kunder. Du kommer att:
 



  




* Kvalitetssäkra redovisning, skatt och rapportering för Permians kunder
* Hantera redovisning av investeringar, eget kapital-transaktioner, vinstutdelningar, emissioner och konsolidering
* Utbilda och leda juniora redovisningskonsulter
* Driva effektivisering och förbättring av processer
* Arbeta med koncernredovisning
* Kommunicera och samarbeta nära med kunder och kollegor för att säkerställa bästa möjliga service
* Få djupgående inblick i kundernas verksamheter, inklusive relevanta avtal och tillämpliga lagar och regler



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




  




* En magister- eller kandidatexamen i ekonomi
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom redovisning, gärna från en redovisningsbyrå och med erfarenhet av kapitalförvaltande bolag
* Gedigen kunskap om redovisningsstandarder (K3 och gärna IFRS), bokslut, moms och skatt
* Erfarenhet av att ge professionell kundserice
* Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift



  





 Det är meriterande om du är auktoriserad redovisningskonsult och har erfarenhet koncernredovisning.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi värdesätter strukturerade och processdrivna medarbetare som trivs med att hantera flera projekt parallellt. Du trivs i en coachande roll och lockas av att få utbilda och vidareutveckla medarbetare – och dig själv. Självklart har du ett starkt kundfokus och gillar att arbeta i team!
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi** 




 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att arbeta med engagerade och kompetenta kollegor. Hos oss får du chansen att utvecklas och växa i din roll, samtidigt som du bidrar till våra kunders framgång. Du får en unik möjlighet att bredda din kunskap inom finansbranschen, med fokus på alternativa investeringsfonder, i ett bolag med stark tillväxt. Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling genom bla både interna och externa utbildningar. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler, mitt i city nära centralen och erbjuder hybridarbete.
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Permian är en snabbväxande och innovativ ledande nordisk fondadministratör med kontor i centrala Oslo och Stockholm. Permiangruppen arbetar med investeringsbolag, riskkapitalfonder och fondförvaltare som tillsammans idag har 200 mdkr under förvaltning fördelade på ett ungefär hundra fonder och investeringsbolag. Som specialist inom fondadministration erbjuder Permian ett brett utbud av experttjänster till nordiska Venture-, Private Equity- och riskkapitalbolag, bl.a. rådgivning, fondadministration, fondförvaltnings-, förvaringsinstitut- och redovisningstjänster. Målsättningen är att minska de administrativa bördorna för kunderna med expertis, IT verktyg och effektivitet.
 



  





 Företaget grundades i Oslo för 10 år sedan och idag är vi 100 personer på plats i Stockholm och Olso.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 I denna rekrytering har Permian valt att samarbeta med SJR. För mer information är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Sara Borgeström på sara.borgestrom@sjr.se. Notera att vi tyvärr inte tar emot ansökningshandlingar via e-post
 



  





 Urval och intervjuer kommer att start i mitten på augusti.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Accountant Nordics (1-year Maternity Cover)
description:
Valtech Nordics is looking for a Senior Accountant to cover a 1-year maternity leave. Are you passionate about finance & accounting, do you have an eye for detail, and does it excite you to get things done in close collaboration with people around the globe? Are you based in Stockholm? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Senior Accountant Nordics** 




 As a Senior Accountant, you fulfil a business critical role. You will mainly be responsible for the accuracy and completeness of the Nordic financial records and collaborate closely with our Finance Shared Services team.
 



  





 As a Senior Accountant, you will lead the full accounting cycle: account maintenance & reconciliation including ledgers and sub-ledgers, monitoring cash management and invoice follow-up, while applying processes and policies to ensure a timely and accurate month-end closing.
 



  





 You will prepare financial reports, participate in audits, and prepare and review tax returns, with a focus on statutory reporting and compliance with Swedish legislation.
 



  





 Additionally, you will be:
 


* Analyzing complex accounting records and managing complex transactions in Oracle Financial Cloud (accruals, loans, leases – IFRS 16, fixed assets, etc.) in compliance with applicable regulations, accounting standards, and internal policies
* Handling various processes related to Payables, Receivables, Cash management and Fixed asset cycles and resolving exceptions across all accounting cycles
* Performing the internal control processes on time and with focus on quality



  





**You and the role** 




 You are someone with a solid experience in accounting with a proven track record of leading an entire accounting process in a complex setting with many stakeholders involved. You are based in Sweden, but you already have experience in working on an international scale and are used to collaborating with Shared Service Center or similar.
 



  





 You thrive in a complex, fast-paced environment and are able to quickly adapt to changes and handle multiple priorities concurrently. You are analytical, accurate and have a great attention to detail. You enjoy taking on new challenges and proactively act on opportunities.
 



  





 You may have a background from audit, professional services or an internal role within similar complex industries.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* 6+ years of proven experience in running accounting processes (Payables, Receivables, General Ledger, Cash Management, Fixed Asset, Tax Returns, internal controls and Audit)
* Strong understanding of local GAAP, IFRS accounting rules, and statutory reporting on the Swedish market
* Proficiency in Oracle ERP or another widely-used ERP
* Strong experience in internal controls and preparing monthly closings
* Fluency in both Swedish and English is a strict requirement for this role



  





**Practical information** 




 Start date: September 2024
 



 Contract duration: 1-year maternity cover (September 2024-Septemeber 2025)
 



 Salary range: 45.000-55.000 SEK/month
 




 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.

title: Estée Lauder Companies is looking for a National Sales Manager for Sweden
description:
ESTÉE LAUDER COMPANIES is looking for a
   

  

 National Sales Manager - Sweden
   

  

*Are you passionate about premium beauty and retail? Are you an experienced leader with strong people and retail skills, who can drive a large sales team towards a common goal? Then you might be our next National Sales Manager based in Stockholm.*
 Estée Lauder Companies at a glance
   

  

 The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MAC, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD BEAUTY, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, and the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 The Estée Lauder Companies offer an exciting opportunity as National Sales Manager with the responsibility of leading our field sales force in Sweden in department stores and perfumeries. You will lead an organization of approximately 150 employees via four District Managers reporting directly to you, and you will be assisted by a Salesforce Coordinator. You will be working with a broad portfolio of our global brands. The Swedish office is based centrally in Stockholm in the old Post Office building - which is close to the Central Station and some of our key stores e.g. Åhlens City. You will be reporting to the Nordic Commercial Director based in the Nordic head-office in Copenhagen.
   

  

 Your high energy level and strong analytical skills enable you to analyze performance and quickly implement action plans, when and wherever needed. You collaborate with your National Sales Manager colleagues in Denmark, Norway and Finland, as well as with the Nordic Education Manager and Brand Directors. You are visible and lead by example, and you thrive on spending time with your team and frequently visit them instore. You make sure to understand the drivers of our retail business and our competitors, and you utilize the KPIs of retail and coach your direct reports to do so, too.
   

  

 On top of your direct National Sales Manager job you will also represent the Estée Lauder Companies in Sweden in industry federations, in public matters, and towards our retail partners, and you thus pay special attention to embody our very high standards and ethics.
   

  

**To Be Successful In This Role, You Will**
* Achieve retail sales targets by channels, retailers, and brands.
* Support, engage, and develop the team of District Managers and in-store staff in department stores and perfumeries.
* Build a strong and trustful network to retail partners and other industry stakeholders.
* Build a talent pool and secure constant succession planning.
* Implement visual merchandising plans via your team according to guidelines.
* Secure execution of our trade plans instore according to the overall retail plan.
* Work closely with the Education team to secure that the sales team meets our high requirements of product knowledge and customer service.
* Monitor costs closely and work to maximize efficiencies.
* Analyze store profitability and suggest actions for improvement.
* Follow team performance as well as business and competitor movements. Build actions and execute immediately.
* Lead the Swedish office team, incl. indirect reports such as HR, Education and Online teams to ensure co-operation and engagement locally in Sweden.


**Qualifications**
 Your Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven work experience as National Sales Manager, Head of field sales, Country Commercial Lead or similar
* Strong retail skills - you know the retail KPIs and how to use them. Experience from within the Beauty industry is a plus but not a requirement.
* Experience with managing a high-performance sales team in a global/international matrix organization.
* Master stakeholder management
* Strong leadership and coaching skills with the focus to develop and build retail sales and leadership capabilities.
* Ability to understand and analyze retail sales performance metrics.
* Solid customer service attitude with excellent negotiation skills
* Strong communication skills
* Available to travel as needed (mainly inside Sweden and to Copenhagen)
* Understand and speak “Scandinavian” and English at a high level


 Your Personality
   

  

 You are a charismatic leader, and you adapt to change easily. The role has many points of contact internally and externally, so it is important that you can build collaborative relationships across teams and roles. Our company standards and ethics are very high, and it is imperative that you embody them with your own behavior. You are a fast learner, and you strive for excellence in execution. You proactively seek ways to improve personal and organizational effectiveness to meet current and future business needs. You learn equally from successes and failures. You must be a listener, a presenter, and a people-person.
   

  

 What We Offer
   

  

 You Will Become Part Of a Passionate Commercial Team Based In All Our 4 Nordic Countries, But Working From The Swedish Office In Central Stockholm With The Possibility Of a Hybrid Working Model. We Offer An Exciting Opportunity To Join a Global Company With a Strong Heritage Within An Innovative And Growing Industry, Including
   

  

* Attractive & Competitive compensation package.
* A hybrid working model with the opportunity to work from home 2 days per week.
* Market competitive pension package and friskvårdsbidrag
* 30 days of vacation
* Wide variety of social office events
* Social networks and Global ERGs (Employee Resource Groups)
* Generous staff discounts on products


 We are the global leader in prestige beauty — delighting consumers with transformative products and experiences, inspiring them to express their individual beauty. We are the only company focused solely on prestige makeup, skin care, fragrance and hair care with a diverse portfolio of 25+ brands sold in approximately 150 countries and territories. Infused throughout our organization is a passion for creativity and innovation — a desire to push the boundaries and invent the unexpected — as we continue the bold work of our founder Estée Lauder. Estee Lauder Companies is an equal opportunities employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.
   

  

**Next Step**
 We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and please note that virtual interviews are part of this recruiting process. Preferred Start date is as soon as possible.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you.
   

  

**Job:** 
 Sales
   

  

**Primary Location:** 
 Europe, Middle East, Africa-SE-AB-
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Standard
   

  

**Schedule:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Shift:** 
 1st (Day) Shift
   

  

**Job Number:** 
 2410614

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
**About Us**




 Integrity360 is the largest specialist IT security consultancy in the country. We secure the networks, infrastructures and information of some of the leading companies in both Ireland and the UK. We are passionate about what we do, so too must be any of our new recruits. Integrity360 is currently expanding at a rapid rate – could you be the newest member to our team? We are fun and dynamic and believe in constant learning and development. Progression is a typical buzz word within the organisation. #Whatsthecatch
 



  





**Job Role / Responsibilities**




 The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic support and managed service team working on multi-vendor environments. The team is the first point of contact offering remote technical support and managed services for a large client base.
 



 The successful candidate will have excellent analytical skills, will be encouraged to work on their own initiative as well as be an integral part of a dynamic team. This role requires you to grow a team of Support engineers, varying in levels of experience and to:
 


* Manage operational tasks daily with minimal supervision
* Provide technical support, advice and further analysis on the vendor products and technologies listed below for our customers infrastructure security needs.
* The provision of detailed and accurate guidance on the use of client products to support our customer base.
* Effectively interact with other members of the team to provide solutions to technical issues.
* Support projects on boarding
* Comply with Integrity360’s internal systems and procedures.
* Incident management; update clients and systems in a timely efficient manor
* Problem management; Identify trends in product failures and reoccurring incidents.
* Responsible for changes for the managed services customer’s networks
* Participate in the on-call rota providing support clients and colleagues 24x7
* Attend Service Review meetings presenting performance exception reports focusing on long term performance and adding value







**Qualification**




 A degree in Computer Science or an equivalent discipline is preferable but it is not a requirement, and applicants with a minimum of 5 years of relevant industry experience in an equivalent role will be given equal consideration.
 



 Knowledge of network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, and the associated network protocols and concepts.
 



 Industry certification is an advantage in one or more of the following:
 


* Fortinet NSE certification 4 or higher
* Checkpoint CCSA/CCSE/CCSM
* Palo Alto PCNSA/PCNSE



  





**Technical Experience:**




*Ideally the candidate will have some knowledge/experience in one or more of the following areas with an desire to grow, learn and develop with the Company;* 



* Strong understanding of network protocols, firewall policies, and security best practices
* Experience with FortiGate firewalls, FortiManager, FortiAnalyzer, FortiAP, Fortimail, FortiAuthenticator and other Fortinet products
* Firewalls product experience across vendor producst, such as: Checkpoint, Cisco ASA, Palo Alto
* Firewall UTM/Sandboxing/App Control experience in CheckPoint, FortiGate, Palo Alto
* IDS/IPS – Fortinet, Checkpoint
* Content Delivery Systems - F5 LTM, GTM, Citrix Netscaler
* Content filtering - Forcepoint
* Web Application Firewall – F5 ASM, FortiWeb
* IPSEC/SSL VPN: CheckPoint, FortiGate, Palo Alto
* Experience with SSE products such as Fortinet, Zscaler and Netskope
* Experience with scripting and automation tools
* Troubleshooting skills with wireshark, fiddler, HTTPwatch















**What you will bring to us:**



* Competent Swedish and English speaker
* A positive attitude is essential in building a rapport with the customer
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* A strong customer/client focus, with a proven ability to manage expectations appropriately, to provide a superior customer/client experience and build long-term relationships
* Ability to interact with personnel at all levels and across all business units within the organisations, and to comprehend business imperatives.
* Ability to work with only minimal supervision.
* Can demonstrate consistency in their work attitude
* Proficiency in performing risk and business impact assessments.



  





**What we will provide for you:**



* Opportunity to gain experience and knowledge in a key field of expertise
* Exposure to many sectors like Financial Services, and the SME sector
* Further education and training to enhance your skillset including indepth vendor training
* Opportunity, if desired, to enhance skills by carrying out a small amount of on site professional services work and to shadow consultants
* We empower you to make your own Information Security or IT history by working with some of our market leading clients
* A team of highly experienced technology and security professionals to work with and support you.
* A leadership team who have a worthwhile mission and who excel at that mission.
* A chance to work with one of the market leaders in Information Security companies (Winner of the AIB Enterprise of the Year Award 2013, Nominated for EY, EOY 2015)
* A company that is going from strength to strength with significant growth plans that we are achieving.

title: vCU Software Developer
description:
**We are seeking someone who:**
* Represents ambition and strength as a valuable team member in a dynamic workplace.
* Demonstrates a self-driven spirit, recognizing the importance of adaptability in ever-changing environments.
* Understands that success is a collective effort, placing a strong emphasis on genuine teamwork.
* Exhibits high levels of drive, determination, and commitment.


**About the Job:**
 We are looking for a talented vCU Software Developer to join our cutting-edge telecom team. This role involves developing and optimizing Layer 2/3 software components for the vCU in a cloud-native environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and optimize Layer 2/3 software for the virtual Central Unit (vCU).
* Implement cloud-native solutions using Kubernetes and Docker.
* Write and maintain high-performance code in C/C++.
* Engage in CI/CD processes and automation using Jenkins and other tools.
* Collaborate effectively in an agile development environment.


**Mandatory Requirements:**
* Extensive experience in Telecom Layer 2/3 software development.
* Proficiency in C/C++ programming and Linux environments.
* Knowledge of cloud-native technologies, including Kubernetes and Docker.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins.


**Desirable Skills:**
* Experience with test automation frameworks.
* Familiarity with DPDK and Smart NICs.


*WHY K TWO?
   

  

 At K Two, our consultants are renowned for their high technical and social competence, extensive experience, responsiveness, and winning demeanor. We value not only skilled developers, technicians, and project managers but also effective consultants. We're in the business of assembling winners. Join us, where working for and with K Two is more than just a job; it's a rewarding experience!*
 Sounds interesting?
   

  

 We hope so! Throughout the selection process, we will place significant emphasis on personal qualities and your commitment. If you believe you align with the above profile and wish to be part of our successful team, we eagerly await receiving your application!

title: Are you our new department assistant?
description:
Leading the shift towards sustainable transport solutions is at the core of our strategy, which requires us to challenge and change how we develop products and services for our customers. One of the areas that needs to be developed quickly is our ability to create new software for our products and services.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of the journey of continuing to build up a department that is responsible for how we develop software at Scania and create a creative and efficient environment where we together lead the department toward future challenges? With modern leadership and principles inspired by a Lean-agile mindset, we want to create a culture and environment that creates innovation, delivers results, and becomes a natural support for the other software groups within Solution Development for the entire TRATON.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a department assistant, you work with the department manager on daily tasks. You are always one step ahead by independently planning managerial calendars, preparing meetings, etc.
   

  

 You actively participate in the department's management team, where you have an overall picture of what is going on and are responsible for the department's annual calendar. You are a driving force in the department's events, communication, and structure where you are responsible for preparation and implementation together with your colleagues in the management team.
   

  

 Furthermore, you work closely with the department's other assistants, and you work closely with improvement work and with developing administrative routines. There, the processes around registration of new employees, authorizations, purchasing, invoices, etc. are designed and led to a couple of sections, as well as coordination of certain work environments within the department. Your role has many contact surfaces and the work is conducted independently and in teams.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 We are looking for someone independent, driven, and proactive with a sense of structure and order and has a big heart for service and relationships. You like to find new ways of working with new technology and are communicative with a good ability to express yourself orally and in writing in both Swedish and English, as we have many international employees.
   

  

 You are a responsible, persistent person who enjoys sometimes working under time pressure.
   

  

 We would like you to have several years of experience in assistant work; It is important that you feel safe and comfortable in the role, you thrive in a role that is changeable and that places great demands on flexibility, and you like to work with people in a technical environment.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a
 **CV** 
 ,
 **personal letter** 
 , and
 **grade copies** 
 . Please apply as soon as possible but no later than
 **2024-08-26** 
 . Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Department manager Michael Skarped 08-553 519 43.

title: Nätverkstekniker till IT-avdelningen på Karolinska Institutet
description:
**Vill du bidra till samtidens och framtidens medicinska forskning och utbildning?**
 Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. I Sverige står vi för drygt 40 procent av den medicinska akademiska forskningen och vi har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar. Sedan 1901 utser Nobelförsamlingen vid Karolinska Institutet mottagare av Nobelpriset i fysiologi eller medicin.
   

  

 Karolinska Institutet befinner sig i en fas av centralisering där bland annat delar av IT-verksamhet flyttas från institutionerna till universitetets centrala IT-avdelning som lyder under Gemensamt Verksamhetsstöd. Detta medför många spännande utmaningar då verksamheten och dess IT-miljö blir allt mer mångfacetterad och ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och mobilitet utan att kompromissa med säkerheten.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Tjänsten som nätverkstekniker är placerad hos Infrastrukturenheten som idag består av ca 25 medarbetare fördelade på de två grupperna Drift och Basinfra.
   

  

 Vårt arbete är strukturerat kring tjänster enligt ITIL & PM3 där du inom tjänsten Nät kommer vara en viktig del med ansvar att förvalta och vidareutveckla vår nätinfrastruktur.
   

  

 Du kommer att verka i en Cisco-nätmiljö med hög säkerhetsnivå där förmågan till samverkan med andra tjänsteområden är central för en lyckad leverans.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna förutsätter att du kan verka proaktivt med drift och planering av befintligt enterprise-nätverk i en storskalig miljö men även reaktivt lösa incidenter i linjearbete.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av vårt enterprise-nätverk
* Incidenthantering och problemhantering
* Omvärldsbevakning inom tjänsteområdet
* Samverkan med andra tjänstegrupperingar inom IT-avdelningen


**Vem är du?**
 Du har
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som nätverkstekniker med aktuell kunskap inom Cisco-produkter, exempel inom Cisco ISE och Cisco DNA-Center.
* Kunskaper i IP switch/routing CCNA eller liknande.
* Kunskaper av manageringsverktyg för central hantering av Cisco-hårdvara.
* Erfarenhet av Ciscos trådlösa lösningar i Campusmiljö.
* Erfarenhet av brandväggar tex Cisco ASA eller Fortinet Fortigate.
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift. Detta är ett krav då det används i det dagliga arbetet.


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete inom universitet eller högskola.


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad, prestigelös, problemlösande och självgående. Du är nyfiken och har en vilja att utvecklas i din roll och har inga problem att ha direktkontakt med verksamheten. Anställningen kräver att du kan organisera ditt arbete och prioritera mellan olika uppgifter. Du ska vara initiativtagande och inte nöja dig med att reparera symptom. En viktig egenskap är din förmåga att samarbeta med kollegor och att du ser det som självklart att ställa upp för dem när det behövs.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid de personliga egenskaperna.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 En kreativ, internationell och inspirerande miljö fylld av kompetens och nyfikenhet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. Vår vision är att driva utvecklingen av kunskap om livet och verka för en bättre hälsa för alla. Här bedriver vi framgångsrik medicinsk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar i Sverige. Som universitet är Karolinska Institutet en statlig myndighet. Det gör att du får goda förmåner genom vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Medarbetare på KI erbjuds också möjlighet till ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Det innebär att om den verksamhet du jobbar i tillåter, så kan du arbeta en del av din arbetstid på distans. Du får även träna fritt i våra moderna friskvårdsanläggningar där utbildad personal finns på plats.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Solna
   

  

*Tio skäl att välja Karolinska Institutet*
**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.
   

  

 Ansökan ska göras via rekryteringssystemet Varbi. I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV utan personligt brev. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du istället att få svara på några frågor om varför du söker jobbet.
   

  

 Vid tillsvidareanställning tillämpar Karolinska Institutet 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad – och bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla? Sök jobb hos oss**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-3087/2024 | Kontakt: Martin Pousette 08-52486623, | Facklig företrädare: Magnus Anå, OFR 08-52486437,magnus.ana@ki.se, Henry Wölling, SEKO henry.wolling@ki.se, Saco-föreningen vid universitetsförvaltningen SACO@uf.ki.se, | Publicerat: 2024-08-12 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-21

title: System Test Engineer to Excillum!
description:
Do you want to work with the company behind the world´s brightest X-ray source? Great, then you´ve come to the right place! Excillum is a leading company in the field of high-end microfocus and nanofocus X-ray sources and was founded in 2007 by researchers from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH). As a System Test Engineer at Excillum, you will be part of a company with a friendly and helpful work environment with humble and motivated colleagues, who all contribute to enable new science, improve medicine and enhance manufacturing by continuous development of state-of-the-art X-ray sources.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Excillum Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Kista
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Excillum designs, develops, and manufactures X-ray sources with the world's highest brightness and with the world’s smallest spot depending on which product line you look at. The X-ray sources are used in a wide range of areas including quality assurance in semiconductors, electronics, and battery manufacturing. Other application areas are in the development of new medicine and research for example in biology, medicine, and material science. Since the start in 2007, Excillum has grown and today we are around 80 employees in Stockholm. You will be part of a growing international company with customers all over the world and you will play an important role in the work verifying our sources. Excillum is characterized by a strong engineering culture and except from your team, you will collaborate with experts in, for example, electronics, software, research, production and sales. Excillum site is in Kista with both lab and production in-house, which means that you will work close to the products you are developing.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* The opportunity to grow with the company
  
* The opportunity to influence working methods and share your knowledge
  
* A company with a friendly and helpful work culture where we listen to each other
  

  


**Work tasks**

 You will part of the newly established System & Test group at Excillum, meaning you will play an important role in building up this position and help Excillum create a vision and strategy for their testing. The goal of the role is dual; both to ensure the design of new products and that they can be tested systematically in production. This includes understanding customer demands, the current test set-up and identifying a strategy to meet customer expectations. As Excillum is a small company this is a broad role where you are encouraged to take overall responsibility and dive into a range of tasks which could include different types of test, review of manuals or customer interactions.
 


  


 You will for example...
 


  

  
* Work in cross-functional projects collaborating with different engineering disciplines as well as product management, service and production.
  
* Conduct hands-on testing, analyze results and together with the team come up with improvements.
  
* Create and implement the production line with appropriate tests.
  

  


**We are looking for**

 For this position, and at Excillum in general, we attach great importance to you as a person and your interest for the position and the company. We believe in the right attitude!
 


  


 Since this is an important role at Excillum, you also need…
 


  

  
* A bachelor or master’s degree within electronics, mechatronics, physics or similar
  
* Several years of work experience with test of industrial products containing both hardware and software
  
* Knowledge in different types of tests
  
* Experience of automated testing. Able to set up automatic test environment and write tests
  
* Experience from production test
  
* Strong knowledge in English
  


  


  

**Other information**



  

  
* Start: Immediate, but an eventual notice period or other circumstances will be considered
  
* Work extent: Fulltime
  
* Location: Kista in Stockholm, Sweden
  
* This recruitment process is conducted by Academic Work. It is a request from Excillum that all questions regarding the position are handled by Academic Work.

title: Camera Systems Development Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 1
 **+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Assignment Description**
 Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a talented and driven Development Engineer to join their Exterior Vision team, specializing in camera systems. In this role, you will play a crucial part in system design and ensure that stakeholder and internal requirements are met to support the camera perception stack. You will also be instrumental in verifying and enhancing the capabilities of their exterior camera data providers at component, system, and vehicle levels.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities:**
* Product Verification: Conduct comprehensive verification of the exterior camera data provider’s capabilities at various levels, including component, system, and in-vehicle.
* Test Management & Maintenance: Develop, implement, and maintain testing procedures to ensure the highest quality and performance of their camera systems.
* Requirements Understanding: Gather and analyze stakeholder and internal requirements for the camera platform, ensuring they are integrated effectively into the perception stack.
* System Development Insight: Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire system development process and ensure coherence across different components and systems. Document and report product status.


**Qualifications:**
* Degree is not relevant if you are able to demonstrate your driven personality and technical competency.
* Hold a European B driving license.


**Desired Attributes:**
* Proactive and Driven: Possess a highly engaged and proactive personality, capable of taking charge of projects and driving them to successful completion.
* Collaboration: Enjoy collaborating with diverse teams and stakeholders to achieve common goals.
* Lifelong Learner: Demonstrate a commitment to lifelong learning and proactively seek information to improve work efficiency. Team members are expected to constantly help each other, step out of specific role-related tasks, and prioritize what leads to the team’s success, including coaching, supporting, and sharing development information and tasks.
* Interdisciplinary Interest: Enthusiastic about working in a dynamic and interdisciplinary technology field, integrating knowledge from various domains.


**Additional Qualifications:**
* Experience in the automotive industry.
* Familiarity with system designing tools (Carweaver, DOORS, TeamCenter, Carcom, etc.).
* Proficiency with verification tools (DSA, DLT, Prompt Command, Git, WinSCP, etc.).


 Note that not all additional qualifications are mandated as prerequisites. It is essential that there is a willingness to learn the aforementioned experiences and skills.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Information Security Engineer
description:
At Billogram, we aim to be the good guys of billing. We profit when our clients' customers are happy and make timely payments, rather than benefiting from missed payments and the subsequent debt collection. We believe that treating people well is a sound business strategy. That's why our invoicing and payments platform is engineered to eliminate friction and add value for both our clients and their customers, thereby enhancing their relationship.
 



  





 To sustain our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for an experienced Information Security Engineer to join our team.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 As an Information Security Engineer at Billogram, you will be a key player in advancing our Information Security initiatives. With the increasing demands of regulatory compliance and enterprise customer expectations, your role will be critical in addressing security-related issues. You will have hands-on involvement in code-based and infrastructure-related security tasks, ensuring our platform meets and exceeds industry standards. We are looking for someone with 5+ years of experience in cybersecurity, with a proven track record in securing complex digital environments.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* **Security Incident Response:** 
 Actively address and resolve open CVEs, findings during incidents, and results from penetration tests and disaster recovery plan (DRP) drills.
* **Hands-on Security Work:** 
 Engage directly in security-related tasks, whether they involve coding or infrastructure. You might not always complete every issue alone, but you will initiate work and drive progress substantially.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with development, IT, and other teams to integrate security best practices across the organization.
* **Continuous Improvement:** 
 Contribute to refining our processes, ensuring security is embedded in every aspect of our operations.



  





**What We Are Looking For:** 




 To thrive in this role, you need to be proactive, self-driven, and comfortable taking the initiative. You should be adept at navigating complex situations, arranging and moderating meetings, and communicating clearly with diverse stakeholders. Your ability to stay focused on finding practical solutions to security challenges will be essential.
 



  





**Key Qualifications & Skills:** 




  





**Essential:** 



* Strong coding experience
* Experience with cloud hosting environments
* Experience with container-based infrastructure
* Solid understanding of security topics
* Fluency in English



  





**Nice-to-Haves:** 



* Experience with AWS
* Experience with Kubernetes
* Experience with Python



  





**What We Offer:** 




 Billogram provides a digital billing and payments platform, revolutionizing a forgotten part of the payments industry: the recurring invoice. Using smart technology, we help companies automate the whole payments process, leading to lower costs, increased profitability, and higher customer satisfaction. We want both sender and recipient to have the best experience possible. But since their interests don’t always align, it’s up to us to come up with smart solutions to satisfy both parties.
 



  





 At Billogram, we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. You will have the freedom and opportunity to develop alongside great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges, and a whole lot of laughs.
 



 We provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



  





**Welcome to the world of Billogram!**

title: Electromobility Design Engineers
description:
***Are you ready to take the next step in your career? ALTEN is looking for engineers with battery and power electronics experience!***




  





  





 ALTEN Stockholm is strengthening all teams within mobility engineering. We believe you have solid experience from battery development or power electronics. As a electro mobility Engineer you are expected to be the expert on battery technology, charging infrastructure and electric propulsion, moreover you are expected to be deeply involved in design, prototyping, and testing of battery systems.
 



  





  





**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS** 




  




* CAD design, Lead Design, Project Management, Test Engineering experience within Electromobility
* Experience from EV engines, EV transmission, DC/DC converters etc
* Familiar with ISO standards for electrical components, functional safety
* HV Battery experience, Battery packs, BMS design, Battery testing, Charging infrastructure etc
* Power electronics and/ or HV electrical component experience
* Knowledge within Catia, Creo and/ or Teamcenter is very valuable
* Bachelor/ Master of Science degree



  





  





**What we offer you** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We believe in growing together by offering opportunities, development and togetherness. ALTEN operates in several different industries, having a wide variety of assignments, coaching managers and training through ALTEN Academy, which means that it will always be possible to develop at ALTEN. Your wishes will guide your way forward.
 



  





  





 As a consultant, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. Through our different internal networks, such as Women@ALTEN and ALTEN Sports you will get the opportunity to drive topics and activities that are close to your heart. At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



  





  





**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in over 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Telecom, Industry, Energy, Aerospace & Defence and Life Science. In Sweden, we are over 1400 committed employees with 10 offices in 10 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



  





  





 For the fourth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen 2023, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Studio Engineer to leading company in Stockholm!
description:
Here is the opportunity for you with solid experience in mechanical design to take the next step in your career. As a Studio Engineer, you will serve as the vital bridge connecting the engineering and design teams, ensuring seamless collaboration and integration between these two essential disciplines. If you are looking for a workplace where you have the opportunity to truly develop together with inspiring co-workers, this might be your dream job. Apply today!

 Our client is building a new organization and is looking for a Studio Engineer who will play an important role in driving the work and the organization forward. The studio engineer is the link between engineering and design, communicating 3D-data and information (criteria) between the relevant parties. You will be responsible to ensure the best balanced solution, both technically and aesthetically. You will be highly involved in development work throughout all phases, both on a detailed and overall level.

* Push issues regarding Technical Design Quality (TDQ) vehicle property and work to meet the target sets.
  
* Keep structure of Enovia releases and criteria files in folder structure.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Work experience from mechanical/design engineering for 5+ years.

title: 1st line servicedeskmedarbetare till vår kund i Sandviken
Business Translator - Data & Analytics
description:
**This is a Stockholm based position spanning for 1 year.**
**Join Our Team: Bridge the Gap Between Ideas and Action**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.  Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As D&A Business Translator, you will work with marketing domain business analysts and experts to understands the strategic needs of the business, identify & structure opportunities that can be solved through data, analytics and AI. You will translate these needs into possible new use cases in both business and technical language.
   

  

**Your Daily Challenges:**
* Analyze commercial, marketing performance, and consumer data.
* Elicit key information using document analysis, requirements, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
* Communicate and collaborate with teams to analyze information and functional requirements and deliver solutions from analytics artifacts to AI applications.
* Collaborate within a Product Team, working alongside architects, data & visualization engineers, data scientists, Product Owners, and marketing subject matter experts/business analysts.
* Establish the technical vision and evaluate tradeoffs between usability and performance requirements.
* Aggregate existing data from Electrolux and external sources such as GA4, DV360, SA360, Meta, Qualtrics, eCommerce, and service systems.
* Transpose hypotheses and methodologies into relevant metrics and applications.
* Develop customized solutions with D&A Engineering and Data Science teams to link, store, locate, and retrieve data using the appropriate infrastructure and tools.


**You are:**
* Bi-lingual: You understand both business and technical languages and naturally act as a translation bridge between the two. You can explain technical concepts in business-friendly language and vice-versa. You support the business users during UATs.
* Excellent collaborator & communicator: You have a proven ability to form strong cross-functional relationships with varying business partners, promoting a strong sense of "we're all in it together."
* Data Analytics: You are a critical thinker who is enterprising, curious, persistent, and strategic, with significant experience in analysis work and using various analytics tools.
* Data driven: You leverage data naturally and drive optimization. You have a strong analytical mind with experience in coordinating analytics and data science projects and teams.
* Agile: You are familiar with working in agile teams, have a sense of urgency, and can quickly adapt to different situations, understanding changes, and reacting confidently and decisively. You have a demonstrated ability to learn quickly and a hunger for continual learning.


**Requirements:**
* Academic degree in (business) computer science or a comparable training
* Sound understanding of systems integration concepts
* Experience in analytics development and handling a wide range of analytical tools and applications (e.g. Power BI, Qlik products, SQL, Python, Databricks)
* Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication skills.
* Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment
* Ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Fluent in English, any other language is a plus


**The location:**
 This is a full-time, fixed-term position for one year, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters we have 60+ nationalities under the same roof, and we enjoy the look and feel of the office.
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the common language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friends benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path

title: Silicon Design - Junior FECAD Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson Silicon is a leading innovator in the semiconductor industry, dedicated to developing cutting-edge technology solutions. We seek a motivated and talented Junior ASIC Developer to join our dynamic team within the newly established Frontend CAD department, which is dedicated to defining methodologies and EDA workflows across our global R&D sites in Austin, Stockholm, and Lund.
   

  

 The Team is part of the Ericsson Silicon engineering unit, which develops state-of-the-art ASICs and FPGAs targeting the newest technology nodes for Ericsson's 5G telecommunication product portfolio. This department offers many opportunities for career growth and a large base of knowledge from which to learn.
   

  

**What You Will Do:**
* Assist in the day-to-day development, deployment, and support of complex Frontend Design & Verification tool flows.
* Contribute to driving innovation in design processes and methodologies.
* Build relationships with Project, Program, and engineering stakeholders, ensuring alignment with project goals and timelines.
* Work closely with different design, verification, testing, and manufacturing teams to foster collaboration.
* Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among various groups.
* Identify and address technical challenges that arise during the silicon design process.
* Assist in implementing processes to ensure the quality of silicon design, including design reviews, testing methodologies, and quality assurance practices.
* Foster a collaborative and positive work environment.


**Skills You Bring** 
 :
   

  

* Basic knowledge of ASIC IP/ASIC SoC design, RTL, Verilog, UVM, and System Verilog.
* Familiarity with front-end tools, including Verilog simulators, RTL/Verification lines, and clock domain crossing checkers.
* Understanding synthesis, static timing analysis, and Design-For-Test (DFT).
* Knowledge of System-Verilog assertions, checkers, and advanced design verification techniques is a plus
* Basic proficiency in scripting languages such as Perl, Python, bash,etc.
* An understanding of modern design methodologies and techniques.
* Ability to coordinate geographically dispersed engineering teams.
* MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. title: Data Infrastructure Engineer - health tech
description:
Platform24 is on a mission to unlock healthcare's potential by creating smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available. We aim to enable AI precision while maintaining a human touch, allowing medical doctors and nurses to focus on what they do best—practicing medicine 🩺.
   

  

 We have an uncompromising focus on making every day better for patients and clinicians and together create healthcare 2.0 🚀.
   

  

 Joining our team as a Data Infrastructure Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech companies. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a large scale.
   

  

**You will, in this role, be**
* Part of a core team working with initiatives spanning the entire company 🌐
* Drive data democratization, both internally and externally, creating informative workflows for us as an organization and our customers, the healthcare organizations, giving them data and insights to help them learn and improve so they can do the right things 🔍
* Be part of a team of individuals with diverse expertise within Analytics Engineering 🧠
* Take on a broad spectrum of responsibilities in developing and maintaining our data platform infrastructure 💾
* Empower other teams and our customers by enhancing their analytical capabilities and promoting a culture of ongoing learning and improvement 📊


 We invite you to join us on this exciting journey, where your contributions will significantly impact the future of healthcare 🌟.
   

  

 Meet Per, the Engineering Manager of the Data & Analytics team, talking about what they do in the team
   

  

**We’re looking for**
* Proficiency in managing and optimizing core platform technologies such as Kubernetes, Helm, and ArgoCD 🛠️
* Interest in learning and applying those learnings in essential data platform components such as Minio, Spark, and Presto 🔥
* Strong understanding of workflow orchestration tools like Airflow for efficient data processing and transformation 🔄
* Proficiency with version control systems and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) 🔗
* Competence in or willingness to learn monitoring and observability tools such as Grafana and Prometheus to ensure the data platform's health, performance, and reliability 🔍
* Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation, complemented by knowledge of Python for scripting and automation tasks within the data platform environment 🐍
* Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams 💬
* Proactive problem-solving attitude and drive to identify and address challenges within the data platform environment 🎯


**What's In It For You**
* At Platform24, we recognize the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working hours to accommodate different life plans ⏳
* We host Demo & Beers every other week to celebrate our achievements (participation in beers is optional) 🍻
* Regular personal growth and knowledge-sharing sessions are organized, along with other benefits like office snacks, parties, and the opportunity to spend five workdays a year doing voluntary work to help others 🥳


 Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work with intelligent, friendly, and skilled colleagues from around the world 🌍.
   

  

 This position is located in our Stockholm office. We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible 🏃‍♂️.
 **(Please note that our team will be on vacation, which may cause some delays in our response times. We will be back by mid-August and will move the process forward as soon as we return).**
 We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs 🌈.
   

  

 Platform24 develops system support for cohesive digital care chains that facilitate increased accessibility, efficiency and medical security. We are the largest company in the Nordic region when it comes to automatic triage for directing patients to the right level of care and the right care unit, even in complex flows along the entire patient pathway.
   

  

 Our customers include healthcare regions, private care providers, and insurance companies.

title: Design Engineer - Otto engine development
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**About Us**
 It is Scania’s ambition to continue its quick growth in the area of sustainable transports and alternative fuels. To adjust resources for this ambition we need to strengthen our group that has the responsibility to provide Scania with viable and sustainable gas driven engines.
   

  

 Our mission is to develop the Otto engine and its performance affecting fuel components. To meet legal and project requirements.
   

  

 Our team is responsible for the design, development and product maintenance of parts in the fuel and ignition systems of our natural gas and biogas fueled otto engines and vehicles. We work tightly together with the engine integration team, our suppliers and other areas within Scania.
   

  

**The role**
 As a development engineer specializing in construction, you'll collaborate with your team to develop, coordinate and plan work to create an efficient and quality-assured product.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Also Include**
* designing new components and ensuring their functionality within the system.
* work closely with our suppliers to ensure quality and timely delivery.
* you to be involved from the start in developing new fuel system items to meet your engine's performance needs.
* write up requirement specifications, test plans and reports, conduct design reviews,
* support other colleagues and participate in technical discussions in various forums.


 This role offers a challenging and diverse work environment, where you'll have significant opportunities to enhance our products, work processes, and methods. Part of the work is also to find the cause of failures that occur on your components and solve problems for customers, both internal and external.
   

  

 If you are interested in combustion engines and are a driven person with the urge to learn new things, we can offer you a challenging position in a stimulating and learning environment. Our dedication lies in developing the best (Methane) Otto engine for our customers.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We think you are a team player, you willingly share your experiences and enjoy working collaboratively to achieve desired results. Practical skills and attention to detail are highly valued. Given the cross-functional nature of the work, strong collaboration and communication skills are essential.
   

  

**We expect you to have:**
* a master's degree in mechanical engineering or an equivalent qualification.
* experience with CNG/LNG in vehicles or other applications.
* a background should include designing and developing components for gaseous-fueled combustion engines or vehicles.
* a genuine interest in internal combustion engines or technology in general.
* good confident at write and speak fluently in English. If you also write and speak fluently in Swedish, it's considered a merit.
* You are positive, committed, and motivated by problem-solving.


 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

**We offer**
 We offer you a rewarding position in a stimulating and learning environment. We will guide you to broaden your knowledge and skills. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support.
   

  

 In addition to career and development opportunities, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's own health center Gröndal, or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, the opportunity to lease a car through the company, and much more. Scania also organizes several events throughout the year where family and friends are always welcome.
   

  

 If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**Further information**
**If you would like to learn more about the position please contact:**
 Heidi Marjamäki, Head of Engine Strategy and Components Alternative Fuels, Heidi.Marjamaki@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and education certificate. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-08-18. Ongoing selection and competency-based interviews will take place during the application period; the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

*Due to the vacation period, we will start handling the applications and answering questions from the 12th of August. From that week, we will have an ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the last application period, therfore the position may be filled before the end of the application period.*
 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description:
**About Us** 




  





 Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.
 



  





 What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.
 



  





  





**Job Role / Responsibilities** 




 This is a full-time position with the Integrity360 office in Stockholm, Sweden. The position is responsible for performing all forms of complex technical activities (including the Internal / External Network, Applications, Cloud, Mobile, etc.). These assessments will occasionally be done at the client site, primarily in Sweden. Proficiency in communication is essential, both written and verbal, as well as the ability to convey complex technical information to key international clients.
 



  





**Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:** 



* Perform in-depth penetration tests across applications, infrastructure, cloud and mobile platforms.
* Execute zero-knowledge black-box, grey-box and white-box penetration tests of specific areas within the enterprise.
* Perform tests and assessments in the cloud, including but not limited to AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
* Perform security reviews of servers, network devices, architecture and application designs.
* Act as an escalation point for team members regarding project-related issues.
* Deliver pre-sales support, including project scoping, estimations, and technical assistance via calls, meetings, and presentations with key clients.
* Enhance Integrity360's security offerings, refining methodologies, reporting standards, and educational materials.
* Represent Integrity360 at international events, forums or training events.
* Demonstrate the ability to be an industry expert.



  





**Required Skills / Experience** 



* 5+ or more years’ experience in penetration testing or red team operations, including testing critical functionality, banking systems and more.
* Manual penetration testing experience above and beyond running automated tools.
* Expertise in AWS, Azure, and cloud-native technologies, including VMs, containers, and infrastructure as code.
* Previous experience as a Subject Matter Expert, or similar role.
* Experience in testing ICS, SCADA, mainframes, containers, hardware appliances,
* Excellent understanding of firewalls, proxies, iptables, AVs and EDR products, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and various networking concepts.
* Knowledge of wireless technologies, mainly RF, Cellular, NFC, and Bluetooth technology.
* Experience in testing OSX / iOS and Android devices.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in front of key clients.
* Experience in developing custom security tools and scripts.
* Fluency in one or more programming or scripting languages: Java, Python, C/C++, C#, .NET, ASP, PHP,



  





**Certifications/Qualifications** 



* One or more industry leading certification (OSCP, CRTE, CRTO, OSCE, OSWP, ARTE, CPTS, etc.)
* CHECK Team Leader or equivalent is a plus.
* Computer Sciences, IT or Cybersecurity related degree is a plus.

title: Säkerhetsspecialist - arbeta med fysisk säkerhet
description:
**Sektionen för fysisk säkerhet, RK Säkerhet, Förvaltningsavdelningen**
 Har du erfarenhet av arbete inom området fortifikatoriskt skydd och säkerhetsteknik
   

  

 samt intresse av projektledning och implementering av säkerhetstekniska lösningar och vill delta i Regeringskansliets säkerhetsarbete? Som vår nya medarbetare får du ett viktigt uppdrag med omväxlande och intressanta uppgifter och många kontaktytor.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 I rollen som säkerhetshandläggare är du specialist inom fysisk säkerhet och ingår i en organisation med ansvar för fysisk säkerhet inom Regeringskansliet. Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att normera, kravställa, leda och följa upp projekt och aktiviteter i olika omfattning inom säkerhetsområdet. Tyngdpunkten ligger på fortifikatoriskt skydd samt säkerhetsteknik i fastighetsprojekt. Du samverkar med både interna och externa intressenter. Din roll innebär även att du kan komma att arbeta med andra uppgifter inom fysisk säkerhet och övrigt inom säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som har en gymnasieexamen och relevant säkerhetsrelaterad utbildning samt flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete inom området fortifikatoriskt skydd och säkerhetsteknik. Vidare har du erfarenhet från att tidigare ha drivit och implementerat säkerhetstekniska lösningar i linjeorganisation och/eller i projektform. Vi ser även att du har erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
   

  

 Du har kunskap om gällande standarder och dimensionering inom området fysisk säkerhet, både fortifikatoriskt och inom säkerhetsteknik och -system samt kunskap om säkerhetstekniska lösningar, såsom teknisk övervakning och fortifikatoriskt skydd. Vidare har du mycket god kunskap i svenska i tal och skrift och god kunskap i engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av projektledning och kompetens inom säkerhetsskydd är meriterande liksom arbete med säkerhetsfrågor i offentlig sektor. Det är även meriterande med kompetens inom säkerhets- och verksamhetsskydd.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 För att lyckas i rollen krävs att du är självgående och planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt. Du är flexibel med förmåga att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter och är uthållig. Du har god samarbetsförmåga, är tydlig samt har bra kommunikativ förmåga. Vidare är du lugn och kontrollerad i stressituationer samt behåller ett realistiskt perspektiv på situationer och fokuserar på rätt saker.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningarna (1 tjänst eller fler) är tillsvidare och inleds med sex månaders provanställning Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta sektionschef Patrik Lidström på 08-405 98 88 (frågor om tjänsten besvaras vecka 33). Du är också välkommen att kontakta HR-handläggare Siri Hågefalk på 08-405 87 83. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Johan Strokirk för Saco och Peter Backéus för ST. Du når dem via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg
 **senast den 2024-08-18**
 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Utvecklare mobila applikationer i Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Brinner Du för app-utveckling, den senaste tekniken och vill du bygga lösningar som används av tusentals användare? Då har vi utmaningen för dig. CGI satsar nu på Unified Commerce och söker en app-utvecklare som älskar att koda!
   

  

 Hos oss på CGI får du chansen att arbeta med stora och välkända kunder i agila projekt där ny-utveckling och den senaste tekniken står i fokus. Du får jobba med programmering, både inom web och app.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som app-utvecklare inom Unified Commerce och mobile sale, kommer du att få arbeta i allt från små och korta projekt på 1-12 månader till stora och långa åtaganden. Hos oss är förvaltning en viktig del av vårt åtagande gentemot kund. Vi driver projekt både på distans, på plats hos våra kunder och från vårt kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi arbetar såväl enskilt som tillsammans med våra nationella och internationella kollegor i våra åtaganden. Våra åtaganden och projekt genomförs med stöd av våra etablerade metoder och modeller som baseras på branschstandarder.
   

  

 Du kommer att få jobba med app-utveckling med fokus på mobile sälj inom nedanstående områden:
   

  

* Analys, design och implementation av appar.
* Bidra med kunskap till ditt team genom kortare seminarier.
* Testa och kvalitetssäkra dina egna och dina kollegors lösningar.
* Skapa integrationer mot tredjepartsprodukter och tjänster som ingår i våra kunders lösningar.
* Bidra till att utveckla vår utvecklingsmetodik och våra ramverk.
* Agera arkitekt i större projekt med fokus på mobilt sälj.


 Du kommer att förstärka vårt utvecklingsteam i Stockholm (även möjligt att sitta på vårt kontor i Gävle) och jobba i huvudsak mot våra lokala och regionala kunder. Du har förmodligen en IT-inriktad akademisk examen med ett gediget teknikintresse.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är lyhörd, ödmjuk och arbetar på ett strukturerat sätt. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från teamleveranser och är van att arbeta i en ledande roll. Du behöver vara flytande i svenska och engelska samt ha en relevant akademisk examen.
   

  

 Önskad erfarenhet:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling inom app-utveckling
* Viljan och drivet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken
* Ledarskap och coachning


**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Ansök redan idag, vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. Om det finns något du undrar över, skicka gärna dina funderingar till Mette Pettersen: m.pettersen@cgi.com eller Kristoffer Renberg: kristoffer.renberg@cgi.com.
   

  

 Just nu är många av oss på semester och det kan därför dröja med återkoppling på din ansökan. Vi tackar för ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt efter semesterperioden.
   

  

**Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig. På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmånder:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Tysktalande teknisk innesäljare till internationellt företag!
Tech Lead - Omni
description:
Are you a senior software engineer passionate about creating impactful solutions? Join Omni’s Brand Team as our Tech Lead! Work with diverse technologies like AI tools, Next.js, Kubernetes, Swift, Kotlin and more to shape the future of our products.
   

  

 At Omni, every idea counts. We thrive in a collaborative, non-hierarchical culture and offer a hybrid work environment with time for personal projects. Be part of a diverse, international team that values innovation and teamwork. This is an operational role with no formal staff responsibilities, allowing you to focus on technical leadership and hands-on development.
   

  

 Ready to make a difference? Check out the full ad and join us on our exciting journey!
   

  

**Your mission:**
* Chart the course: Lead in technical decisions, take overall responsibility for our technical architecture, and ensure everyone is on the same page.
* Raise the bar: By introducing new technologies and methods, you enhance the efficiency and quality of our work.
* Share knowledge: Be a patient mentor who actively helps the team grow and improves code quality through constructive feedback and advice.
* Solve problems: Proactively identify and manage technical risks, ensuring we stay ahead.
* Take responsibility: In close collaboration with the Product Manager and UX Lead, ensure our projects are delivered on time and with high quality.
* See the big picture: Keep an eye on the current architecture and think ahead to ensure our solutions are robust, scalable, and sustainable over time.


**Who you are:**
* A communication star: You can easily explain complex technical concepts both in writing and verbally so that both other programmers and less technically savvy individuals understand.
* A problem solver: You actively participate in the initiation of new projects and initiatives. You understand business needs and can translate them into technical solutions that the team then brings to life together.
* Flexible and humble: You are open to new ideas and ready to dive into coding and code reviews when needed.
* Experienced: You have a solid background in software development and a passion for sharing your knowledge.
