title: Design and Marketing Intern
description:
Are you a passionate creative with a strategic mindset? Cellcolabs, a cutting-edge biotech start-up, is seeking a design and marketing intern to join our ambitious marketing team and play a pivotal role in shaping our company's branding and social media presence.
   

  

**About Cellcolabs**
 Cellcolabs is a biotech impact start-up on a mission to disrupt healthcare as we know it through advanced cell therapies. Mesenchymal Stem Cells (MSCs) have shown groundbreaking potential to treat and prevent a myriad of diseases and ailments. Through efficient, large-scale production of MSCs, Cellcolabs fuels the advancement of MSC cell therapies – to ultimately improve global health.
   

  

 Cellcolabs is based on 20 years of research from Karolinska Institutet and is approved for GMP production of ATMPs by the Swedish Medical Products Agency. The company is founded and backed by some of Sweden’s foremost health and life science entrepreneurs as well as Norrsken. Cellcolabs is a flat organization, and you will work closely with all members of the marketing team and colleagues of various backgrounds. Your own initiatives and creative thinking are critical to our success.
   

  

**What You Can Expect To Learn And Practice**
**Graphic Design:** 
 Create graphics and visuals for social media, brochures, and PowerPoints, ensuring brand consistency and engagement.
   

  

**Content Planning:** 
 Gain insights into developing and planning engaging content for social media platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.
   

  

**Campaign Collaboration:** 
 Work alongside the Digital Marketing Manager to conceptualize and execute social media campaigns.
   

  

**Channel Management:** 
 Learn how to maintain and enhance our presence on various social media channels.
   

  

**Content Creation:** 
 Develop skills in writing and publishing compelling content that resonates with our audience.
   

  

**The Ideal Candidate**
* Knowledge of design and visual identity principles, including grid structures, typography, layout and color theory.
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or a related field.
* Creative, proactive, and a doer.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
* Strong understanding of social media strategies and trends.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate concepts and objectives clearly.


**Internship Details**
* Timeframe: September to June, with potential for extension.
* Work Hours: Full-time, with a possibility for 50% from September to October.
* Location: Office in Stockholm (with some possibility for remote work)
* Compensation: This is a paid internship.

title: DNB Markets - Equity Research Internship - Spring and Summer 2025
description:
Our people are the DNA of DNB. Since 1822, bright minds have worked together to find the best solutions for our customers. Today, DNB is much more than Norway’s largest bank, and a key player in the Norwegian economy. We are a technology driven financial institution, constantly adapting our operations and tailoring our services to the time we’re living in and to the future. In DNB, you’ll find a wide range of career opportunities in Norway and internationally. We are among the best companies in the world when it comes to gender equality, and we take good care of the diversity represented by the people who choose to work here.
   

  

 DNB is the second largest financial services group in the Nordics, and Norway´s largest. DNB Markets offers a wide range of products and services, including risk management products, investment products, capital markets/advisory, research, sales and securities services. Working in customer facing teams and applying deep market knowledge combined with good digital solutions, the DNB Markets employees provide advice and tailor-made solutions for a wide range of customer segments.
   

  

 DNB Markets is one of the leading investment banks in the Nordics with about 700 employees and offices in ten countries across the world. Our experienced professionals assist our clients with a broad range of financial products and services within equities, advisory, capital markets, fixed income, foreign exchange, interest rate and commodity derivatives.
   

  

 Our culture is characterized by a very high energy level, strong business focus and excellent teamwork between people with an open and inclusive mind-set where we believe in innovation through co-operation. Therefore, we want people that are not only dedicated to our business but also committed to the way we work together.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer a 10 week full-time internship in the Stockholm team starting in January, March and June 2025 . We offer the right candidates the opportunity to gain insight into, and understanding of, working in an equity research department, as well experience from working with some of the best research analysts in the Nordics. As an Equity Research intern at DNB, you will assist in building and maintaining detailed financial models, write company research reports and investment recommendations, follow market and industry developments, and analyse company and industry data to generate actionable investment ideas.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* A desire to learn more about work within equity research.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish or Norwegian
* Strong academic results
* Completed minimum two years of relevant studies.


**Application**
 Please send your application to DNB Markets Equity Research Internship no later than the 22nd of September 2024.
   

  

**Contact**
 For questions and more information about DNB Markets Equity Research Internship, please contact HR, email rekrytering@dnb.se
   

  

 As a qualitative step in DNB’s recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check to increase awareness of our future employees, secure work environment and meet regulatory requirements.  The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.   https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/
   

  

 In this job application process, you only need to upload your resume (CV) and briefly answer some job-related questions. Cover letter is not required but you can upload this under attachments if desired.
   

  

 As an employer DNB is encouraging all kind of internal mobility such as recruitment, job rotation, special assignments etc. This is an opportunity for you to take on a new career challenge within the company and get valuable personal and competence development. Some open positions are only published internally and can only be applied for by employees and consultants at DNB.
   

  

 When applying for a position it is only the hiring manager and HR who have access to your application.

**East Capital International AB**

 East Capital Group is an independent asset management group that comprises several strategies and specialisations to offer active management solutions in equities, bonds, and real estate assets. Their managers work within a clear ESG framework, while also drawing on the group’s scale and overall strengths.
 


  


 Founded in Sweden in 1997 and with offices in Stockholm, Hong Kong, Luxemburg, Tallinn, Vilnius and Riga, East Capital Group manages a total of EUR 2,7 billion for a broad range of international investors including leading institutions, companies, and private individuals.
 


  


 East Capital Group also has a significant holding in the listed company Eastnine (OM:EAST), which owns, develops and manages sustainable, premium office space in the Baltic region with a net asset value of approximately EUR 573 million.
 


  


 Their investment strategy is based on extensive company knowledge gained through proprietary fundamental analysis and frequent company meetings.

title: DNB Markets - IBD Sustainable Finance Internship - Spring 2025
description:
Our people are the DNA of DNB. Since 1822, bright minds have worked together to find the best solutions for our customers. Today, DNB is much more than Norway’s largest bank, and a key player in the Norwegian economy. We are a technology driven financial institution, constantly adapting our operations and tailoring our services to the time we’re living in and to the future. In DNB, you’ll find a wide range of career opportunities in Norway and internationally. We are among the best companies in the world when it comes to gender equality, and we take good care of the diversity represented by the people who choose to work here.
   

  

 Are you interested in understanding the role that banks can play in supporting a sustainable transition? Would you like to work with companies across sectors and regions, supporting them on their ESG agendas? Then, an internship in our Sustainable Finance team might be a good opportunity for you.
   

  

 Transitioning into a more sustainable future requires large amounts of capital, and the financial industry has a key role to play in promoting climate-resilient and low-carbon growth. We are currently experiencing an increasing demand for sustainable financing and investment solutions among our clients, and we are continuously increasing our efforts within sustainable finance.
   

  

 DNB Markets is one of the leading investment banks in the Nordics with about 700 employees and offices in ten countries across the world. This includes assisting clients issuing green, social and sustainability-linked bonds and loans, as well as advising companies ahead of an IPO on how to highlight and enhance their sustainability profile from a capital markets perspective. title: Master's Thesis: Optimal corrugated board for minimum stripiness
description:
Master's Thesis: Optimal corrugated board for minimum stripiness
   

  

**Master Thesis: Optimal corrugated board for minimum stripiness in flexo post-printing**
**Thesis subject/Assignment**
 The goal of this project is to develop a method to be used to create ideal corrugated boards regarding stripiness of flexo post-printing. This work will rely mainly on FEM models and simulations.
   

  

**Purpose of the project**
 Corrugated board is a commonly used packaging material for transport goods and e-commerce, while flexo post-printing is the most used printing method for this material. When running through a print nip consisting of two rigid cylinders (one covered with flexible polymeric print plate), the corrugated board is subjected to compressive deformations. Depending on the materials compositions of the corrugated board (the outer and inner liners, the fluting medium, and glue conditions), the properties of the polymer plate, etc, the stripy patterns (known as stripiness) of the prints vary. It is therefore desirable to be able to predict the stripiness tendency from the properties of the materials components of the corrugated board (outer & inner liners, fluting), glue characteristics, etc. This may pave the road for reduced or minimized stripiness in post flexo-printing.
   

  

 Printing dynamics of corrugated board is an active research area at RISE. The method developed in this project is expected to provide industry with a powerful tool for product development. To achieve this, you will work together with other researchers and lab engineers who will help you to start up your project and help you on the way.
   

  

 Project activities will include
   

  

* Literature survey on the state-of-the-art in the frame of the project objectives.
* Development FEM models for flexo post-print systems.
* Printing dynamics simulation of printing systems having different materials compositions / combinations.
* Analysis of results – to find the optimal materials combinations for minimal stripiness tendency.
* Final report (Master’s thesis).


**Who you are ?**
 We are looking for a master’s student within the area of Solid Mechanics or Physics. Good command in modelling and simulation is essential. The start date is flexible yet not later than Jan. 2025.
   

  

**Terms**
 The master thesis work will be carried out at RISE in Stockholm or Kista, corresponding to 30 ETCs. For such an approved work, a stipendium of 30 000 SEK will be rewarded. For more details contact Roger Källberg, roger.kallberg@ri.se, 010 510 51 75.
   

  

 Supervisors:
   

  

 Li Yang (li.yang@ri.se), 010 228 45 22
   

  

 Johan Alfthan, (johan.alfthan@ri.se), 010 228 45 82.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 The application deadline is Sep. 10th, 2024. The selection process will begin immediately after the deadline.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Are you interested in contributing to the advancement of AI in mobile and web app development? Join us as an AI Engineer at Bontouch, where you'll play a key role in integrating Generative AI and Large Language Models into transformative applications for global brands. This role involves developing and deploying scalable AI solutions that enhance functionality and user engagement. If you’re passionate about innovation in a collaborative setting and eager to continuously learn and grow, we invite you to help us shape the future of digital experiences. Together, let’s make a meaningful impact.**

### **BECOME A PART OF THE TEAM**

  

At Bontouch, we work based on one simple but ambitious principle: to make the world’s greatest apps for the best brands on the planet. Currently, we work with partners such as Swish, PostNord, SJ, SEB, among many others, to build highly useful, beautiful-looking mobile and web apps that make life easier for millions of users in the real world.


During summer 2023, we joined forces with Denmark’s leading app agency Shape as well as Waterland Private Equity with the goal to **create** the **leading digital product agency worldwide.** **This new venture is called Framna, and we want you to be part of our journey!**

Joining our office in Stockholm, you will get to work in a cross-functional dedicated in-house team consisting of developers, designers, QA testers, analysts, and a product lead and team lead.


Your day-to-day will include everything from leading AI research and model development, and deploying solutions at scale, to communicating, educating, and managing stakeholders and their expectations.


Finally, you also have the support of other AI enthusiasts with different backgrounds, such as data analysts, developers, and designers, who work on our AI projects to learn from one another, share experiences, develop new skill sets, and collaborate.

### **WHAT YOU'LL DO**

  

As an AI Engineer with us, you’ll play a crucial role in pushing our AI initiatives forward, ensuring they're not just well-loved, but also tailored to our users’ needs. If you're into dreaming up big AI ideas and getting your hands dirty coding and deploying them, you'll fit right in here.


More specifically, in your role, you will be:

* Leading the exploration and application of LLMs and Generative AI, venturing into new areas within these fields, including multi-modal capabilities. You will be the go-to expert when creating new business opportunities, assisting sales, and pitching AI solutions to our partners.
* Developing, testing, deploying, and evaluating AI models, focusing on scalability and efficiency.
* Managing and improving data pipelines that are the backbone for training our AI models, making sure they perform at their best.
* Collaborating in cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions and lead projects that enhance our AI capabilities.
* Sharing what you learn and discover about AI with our internal teams and external partners. Your insights will help us all grow.
* Taking the lead on internal projects using Generative AI to make our company smarter and more efficient, leveraging all the cool AI tools out there.
* Keeping your finger on the pulse of the latest AI trends and breakthroughs, so we’re always ahead of the curve.

### **WHO WE THINK YOU ARE**

  

Are you ready to make this role your own? We believe you might feel at home with us if you have:

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
* Hands-on work experience in AI, machine learning, LLMs, including prompt engineering, fine-tuning, RAG.
* Experience with at least one of the cloud platforms, AWS, Azure, and GCP.
* Strong programming skills in Python and experience with DevOps tools such as Kubernetes and Docker.
* Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g. LangChain, LLM orchestration frameworks).
* Experience with data engineering tools and platforms, and can handle large, complex datasets.
* Great problem-solving and analytical skills, with an ability to work on complex projects and translate business challenges into AI/ML-driven solutions.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, both internally and externally.
* An adaptable and collaborative spirit, you thrive in a changing environment and enjoy working collaboratively with a team dedicated to innovation.

### **BENEFITS OF WORKING AT BONTOUCH**

* A beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm, a hybrid-remote work setup, flexible working hours, as well as some other pretty neat benefits like a generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and much more.
* A culture of sharing. We have Friday demos, Wednesday lunch-and-learn, conceptathons, and Product Lead camps. We host an internal conference with all of our studios once a year – every time in a different part of the world. ️
* A flexible environment where you get to explore and create your role based on your passion.

**Are you curious about our benefits and what it is like to work with us?** **Read about us here**


### **ABOUT BONTOUCH**

  

At Bontouch, we work based on one simple but ambitious principle: to make the world’s greatest apps for the best brands on the planet. To have the greatest impact on users all over the world, we partner up with our favorite companies to create highly useful, beautiful-looking, visionary mobile and web apps that make life easier for millions of users in the real world. We work with partners such as Swish, PostNord, SJ, SEB, among many others. We offer our partners a unique long-term engagement model where we provide all the skills required for modern digital product development including strategy, design, development, testing, and maintenance.


What is the secret of our success? We are a team, we work together, learn from each other, and trust in each other. For us, collaboration, knowledge exchange, our diverse backgrounds, and shared passion for creating the best possible digital products are our winning combination. We work together in-house in our Bontouch studios to ensure that we deliver products of the highest quality with the end user in focus.


Bontouch is the leading app agency in Sweden and has together with leading agency in Denmark (Shape) joined forces with Waterland Private Equity in 2023 with a joint ambition to create the leading digital product agency worldwide. Today the group consists of more than 400 employees across offices in Copenhagen, Stockholm, Zurich, New York, London, Åre, Östersund and Kalmar. The group will continue to grow organically while pursuing international expansion through acquisitions of digital product agencies that have achieved a leading position in their respective markets by delivering best-in-class mobile apps.

### **HIRING PROCESS**


️ Psychometric assessment - Skills and Logical Reasoning test


1st meeting with the Talent Acquisition Specialist

  

Technical challenge and case study presentation


Final meeting

title: Testledare till uppdrag i Luleå!
description:
Vill du ta ditt ledarskap inom testning till nya höjder? Vill du vara en del av ett företag som är experter på att utveckla offentlig sektor? Då har vi en spännande möjlighet för dig!


Just nu söker vi en erfaren testledare till uppdrag hos våra nyckelkunder. Tillsammans strävar vi efter att stärka vårt erbjudande till våra kunder inom offentlig sektor i Luleå.

**Rollen**


Som testledare hos oss kommer du att ha en central roll i att säkerställa kvaliteten och effektiviteten i kundens testarbete. Du kommer att ansvara för att planera, organisera och genomföra testaktiviteter. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer främst att bestå av testning med fokus på automatisering. Arbetssätten är agila enligt ex. Continuous Delivery, DevOps, Scrum eller Kanban.

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden kommer att vara:**

* ledning och koordinering av testarbete
* utarbeta teststrategier och testplaner
* genomföra riskanalyser och ta fram testfall
* säkerställa att testarbetet utförs enligt definierade riktlinjer och standarder
* rapportera och följa upp testresultat
* hantera och lösa eventuella avvikelser och problem som uppstår under testprocessen
* kontinuerligt förbättra testprocessen.

**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen som testledare hos oss ser vi att du har följande erfarenheter och kompetenser:**

* erfarenhet av att leda testarbeten och testteam
* god förståelse för testmetoder och processer
* erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder och ramverk som ex. Continuous Delivery DevOps, Scrum eller Kanban
* erfarenhet av att arbeta i storskaliga och komplexa tekniska miljöer
* relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT
* har erfarenhet av automatiserat testarbete
* har god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i både tal och skrift.

**Om Agio**


Agios personalidé är att det skall vara kul och utvecklande på jobbet. Vi arbetar i en stimulerande miljö som genomsyras av engagemang, kunskap och ansvar. Vi erbjuder en miljö där människor trivs.


Agio är ett stabilt och tryggt bolag med stark ekonomi. Du kommer till ett företag med långvariga kundrelationer och samarbeten. Vi erbjuder intressanta uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal — vi tar ansvar för dig och dina kollegor.  

  



**Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär som testledare och bli en del av vårt Agio-lag ser vi fram emot att höra ifrån dig!** Ansök genom att svara på några korta frågor.


Ansök senast den **30 september.**

**Kontakt**

  

Mattias Nilsson  

mattias.nilsson@agio.se  

tel: 070 385 2256


Ida Randers  

ida.randers@agio.se  

tel: 076 826 3112

title: Dataanalytiker till uppdrag inom offentlig sektor!
description:
**Agio är en ledande leverantör av BI-lösningar till företag inom privat- och offentlig sektor. Vi jobbar med framtidens energisystem, brottsbekämpning och effektiviserar hanteringen av vårdinformation.**


Är du en driven och erfaren dataanalytiker som har en fallenhet att förstå, kommunicera och visualisera data kan denna roll vara något för dig!


Vi söker erfarna dataanalytiker som vill ansluta till vårt BI team i Stockholm eller Luleå. Vi har stor efterfrågan på vår kompetens i gruppen och teamet vill breddas med fler kollegor som tillsammans stärker utbudet till våra nyckelkunder inom offentlig som privat sektor.

 **I din kommande roll**


I din roll på Agio kommer du att bidra till att skapa nya insikter och främja datadrivet beslutsfattande hos våra kunder. Våra kunder står inför utmaningar där de behöver dra nytta av digitaliseringen möjligheter för att effektivisera och automatisera sina verksamheter. Vi ser ett ökat behov av kompetens kring avancerad statistisk analys och automation.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

* har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom dataanalys eller statistik
* har minst 5 års erfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker
* erfarenhet av prediktionsanalys
* erfarenhet av Power BI
* har en vana av att arbeta med komplexa miljöer med fokus på att skapa rätt handlingar från data
* har erfarenhet av agil utvecklingspraxis som ex. SCRUM, Kanban, DevOps
* har goda SQL-kunskaper
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.

**Vi ser det som meriterande** om du har tidigare erfarenhet av SSIS/SSAS, kunskap i R eller Python, samt erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer ex. Azure eller AWS. Kunskaper inom informationssäkerhet, GDPR och säker implementering av analysverktyg är även det meriterande.

**Teamet**


Du kommer till ett lag på Agio med snart 100 kollegor som besitter olika roller och kompetenser där du tillhör vårt beslutsstödsteam med BI-konsulter med liknande kompetenser som dig. Teamet jobbar Microsoftorienterat och jobbar idag från Stockholm och Luleå. Området och du är prioriterade satsningar och du blir en nyckelspelare i teamets fortsatta utveckling.

 **Agio erbjude****r dig**

* Uppdrag med storskaliga och samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar av BI
* En anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och samarbeten
* Balans i livet där det finns plats för både familj och fritid
* Anställning med kollektivavtal – vi tar ansvar för dig och dina kollegor
* En lönemodell som kombinerar anställningstrygghet med rörlig del och vinstdelning


Agio är ett stabilt och tryggt bolag med stark ekonomi. Du kommer till ett företag med långvariga kundrelationer och samarbeten. Vi erbjuder intressanta uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal — vi tar ansvar för dig och dina kollegor.

**Är du vår nya kollega?** Skicka in din ansökan genom att svara på några korta frågor. **Ansök senast den 15 september.**

 **Kontakt**


Ida Randers  

ida.randers@agio.se  

Mob: +4676 826 31 12

title: Erfaren teknisk testare/testautomatiserare – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en erfaren teknisk testare/testautomatiserare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 60-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
  
Du kommer att erbjudas en gedigen utvecklingsresa och dina kunskaper kommer omvandlas till nytta som gör skillnad. Du är alltid uppbackad av erfarna kollegor samt den gemensamma kunskapen som utgör kärnan i företagets framgångar.
  
  

**Du har några av dessa egenskaper/erfarenheter:**  

Utbildning på kandidatnivå
  
Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet
  
Teknisk testning
  
Testautomatiseringsverktyg (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, Test Complete, UFT)
  
Agila arbetssätt
  
CI/CD-verktyg (Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
Programmering (JavaScript, Java)
  
Enhetstestramverk (JUnit, Cucumber)
  
Versionshantering (Git)
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Kunskap inom modern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som Kubernetes plattformar)
  
Att ta fram teststrategier
  
Att coacha andra inom testautomation
  
Sätta upp ramverk
  
ISTQB-certifiering
  
  

**Du får:**  

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
  
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
  
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
  
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
  
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Erfaren teknisk testare/testautomatiserare – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**We are looking for a Software Engineer for our client. You will be part of an agile DevOps team that has the task to deliver a global tax invoicing solution for our client. Your main assignment will be to support the project and as part of the DevOps team continue to develop an application where co-workers can interact with the solution and perform different tasks related to tax invoices. The core solution is using an event based micro service architecture and is built on Spring boot, Kafka Streams, Postgresql, Elastic Search and Kotlin. The co-worker application front-end is developed in Flutter/Dart. The co-worker application back-end is developed in Kotlin (REST, Kafka).**


### **Requirements**


* Strong experience in Flutter.
* Development of new features in the co-worker application (using Flutter).
* Support the team in setting up automated tests for the co-worker application functionality.
* Transfer Flutter development knowledge to other team members.
* Skilled in building applications using Flutter as front end language.

title: Test automation engineer with interest in Complex Investigation \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!

SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!**About the role:**
As test automation engineer in the Complex Investigation team, you’ll embark on an innovative journey in quality assurance and test automation.
The team is developing and maintaining solution for Complex Investigation within Financial Crime Prevention to be able to detect bad actors.  

Your mission as a tester will be to assure quality in our delivery, both with manual testing and to design and implement automation using our self-developed framework, aligning with our overarching test strategy. **To thrive in this role, we believe you have*** Experience and devotion in testing with knowledge in test automation.
* A DevOps mindset and versatility in technical approaches.
* Proficiency in Java and experience with GitHub Actions and adequate CI/CD tools.
* Familiarity with OpenShift, Docker or Google Cloud will be an advantage.
* Analytical thinking and capability of untangling complex technical challenges.
* Openness to change and thrive on new technologies and continuous improvement.
* Proactivity as a team player who values collaboration and collective success.

  

At SEB, you have great development opportunities, within a highly collaborative environment. The position is in Solna, Arenastaden. We embrace a hybrid work model, providing employees with eligible roles and tasks to work remotely up to two days a week. **What we offer:*** Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. If you have questions about the position, please contact Ghazal Zabihi at ghazal.zabihi@seb.se. Please note that we are not able to handle applications via email due to GDPR.
**Learn more about working at SEB** www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Data Scientist in Fraud Prevention Team \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
Do you see the potential in data and want to contribute to accelerating our data driven automation journey using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and other data driven automation tools? Then this might be the right challenge for you!

We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Data Scientist to join our group of data professionals. Our Fraud Prevention Team is a function within the AML & Financial Crime Prevention Area supporting business across multiple business areas. Our mission is to empower Fraud Prevention by unlocking the potential of data we create in our processes to identify improvements with a focus on data driven automation. We provide support to enable data-driven decision-making and leverage process intelligence across Fraud Prevention.

As a part of the SEB Group, we provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 2800 employees consistently strive to enhance business development and growth. If you want to be part of an engaging and enabling environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine.  

About the role:
As a Machine Learning Data Scientist, you will play an important role in accelerating our organization's data journey and creating business value. In this role you are expected to understand business needs and pain points in the process flows that can be addressed through data-driven solutions. You will have to analyse large datasets, apply advanced statistical and machine-learning techniques to drive actionable insights, data-driven decisions and improve our fraud prevention solutions.
At SEB, we embrace a hybrid work model, providing employees with eligible roles and tasks to work remotely up to two days a week.  

Core roles and responsibilities:* Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs and identify problems that can be solved using AI/ML techniques.
* Identify opportunities for AI/ML use cases, focusing on optimizing our manual processes and improving customer service.
* Lead and drive data workstreams engaging stakeholders and cross-functional teams in the implementation of the solutions.
* Collect, clean and analyse large amounts of data from various sources using various tools, methods, and formats to create business insights.
* Create ML algorithms and models to address specific business challenges and identify business opportunities.
* Deploy models into the production environment, maintain, monitor performance and secure reliability.
* Collaborate with the Data, ML/AI, Cloud/Data Engineers, Data Scientists and DevOps teams across the bank to accelerate AI/ML use cases.
* Collect and refine business requirements using various methods, such as data-driven insights, interviews, document analysis and workflow analysis.

  

To thrive in this role, we believe you have:* You have a strong academic background in Machine Learning and Data Science (at least hold a Master’s degree in relevant fields).
* You have working experience as a Machine Learning and Data Scientist or similar role for at least 3 years and have been involved in developing and deploying ML models for solving business problems.
* You have experience in MLOp’s principles and how to apply them and possible ideas into production.
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership.
* You have great communication skills and fluency in English.
* You have great data visualization techniques, the ability to create meaningful visualizations and communicate insights.
* You have experience working with big data platforms using Apache Spark and Hadoop.
* You have proficiency in Python, Scala and Java programming language and have experience working with ML.
* You have experience working with a Cloud solution (Google Cloud Platform is preferred).



What we offer:* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits

  


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. If you have questions about the position, please contact Agnes Kemper at agnes.kemper@seb.se. Please note that we are not able to handle applications via email due to GDPR. **Learn more about working at SEB** www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Dataanalytiker till uppdrag inom offentlig sektor!
description:
**Agio är en ledande leverantör av BI-lösningar till företag inom privat- och offentlig sektor. Vi jobbar med framtidens energisystem, brottsbekämpning och effektiviserar hanteringen av vårdinformation.**


Är du en driven och erfaren dataanalytiker som har en fallenhet att förstå, kommunicera och visualisera data kan denna roll vara något för dig!


Vi söker erfarna dataanalytiker som vill ansluta till vårt BI team i Stockholm eller Luleå. Vi har stor efterfrågan på vår kompetens i gruppen och teamet vill breddas med fler kollegor som tillsammans stärker utbudet till våra nyckelkunder inom offentlig som privat sektor.

 **I din kommande roll**


I din roll på Agio kommer du att bidra till att skapa nya insikter och främja datadrivet beslutsfattande hos våra kunder. Våra kunder står inför utmaningar där de behöver dra nytta av digitaliseringen möjligheter för att effektivisera och automatisera sina verksamheter. Vi ser ett ökat behov av kompetens kring avancerad statistisk analys och automation.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

* har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom dataanalys eller statistik
* har minst 5 års erfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker
* erfarenhet av prediktionsanalys
* erfarenhet av Power BI
* har en vana av att arbeta med komplexa miljöer med fokus på att skapa rätt handlingar från data
* har erfarenhet av agil utvecklingspraxis som ex. SCRUM, Kanban, DevOps
* har goda SQL-kunskaper
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.

**Vi ser det som meriterande** om du har tidigare erfarenhet av SSIS/SSAS, kunskap i R eller Python, samt erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer ex. Azure eller AWS. Kunskaper inom informationssäkerhet, GDPR och säker implementering av analysverktyg är även det meriterande.

**Teamet**


Du kommer till ett lag på Agio med snart 100 kollegor som besitter olika roller och kompetenser där du tillhör vårt beslutsstödsteam med BI-konsulter med liknande kompetenser som dig. Teamet jobbar Microsoftorienterat och jobbar idag från Stockholm och Luleå. Området och du är prioriterade satsningar och du blir en nyckelspelare i teamets fortsatta utveckling.

 **Agio erbjude****r dig**

* Uppdrag med storskaliga och samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar av BI
* En anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och samarbeten
* Balans i livet där det finns plats för både familj och fritid
* Anställning med kollektivavtal – vi tar ansvar för dig och dina kollegor
* En lönemodell som kombinerar anställningstrygghet med rörlig del och vinstdelning


Agio är ett stabilt och tryggt bolag med stark ekonomi. Du kommer till ett företag med långvariga kundrelationer och samarbeten. Vi erbjuder intressanta uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal — vi tar ansvar för dig och dina kollegor.

**Är du vår nya kollega?** Skicka in din ansökan genom att svara på några korta frågor. **Ansök senast den 15 september.**

 **Kontakt**


Ida Randers  

ida.randers@agio.se  

Mob: +4676 826 31 12


  
Team
Beslutsstöd när det är som bäst
Roll
Dataanalytiker
Platser
Agio Stockholm

title: Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer
description:
This role is an opportunity for a hands-on, but literally hands-off, technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.
   

  

 As an SRE & Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.
   

  

 In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.
   

  

 You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.
   

  

 As a Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer engineer you will
   

  

* Apply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processes
* Automate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems
* Develop new features and improve the resilience and scalability of the existing cloud and container portfolio at Canonical
* Maintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructure
* Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; design, implement and maintain monitoring and alerting for various systems and services
* Collaborate with development teams to design service architecture, documentation, playbooks, policies and operational procedures
* Provide assistance and work with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers
* Be given uninterrupted development time to focus on larger projects and automation of manual tasks
* Share your experience, know-how and best practices with other team members in design sessions, mentorship and 'doing work together'
* Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* A deep experience of, and knowledge to define operations in code, using version control, peer review and CI/CD to roll out changes both to applications and infrastructure
* Strong modern engineering background (peer-review, unit testing, SCM, CI/CD, Agile)
* Python software development experience, with large projects
* Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls
* Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases
* Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers
* Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
* Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field
* Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person
* Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate
* A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly
* Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments
* Happy to work within distributed teams
* Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren DevOps-ingenjör med intresse för teknik och att ständigt utvecklas? Vill du hjälpa våra kunder att göra världen lite bättre? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

 HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher såsom exempelvis fordon, fintech, myndigheter, medtech och telekom. Förutom att vi bidragit till utvecklingen av att snart bli ett kontantlöst samhälle, utvecklar vi även allt från digitaliseringen av elkraftsystem till framtidens autonoma fordon. Enkelt sagt, vi gillar att skapa sådant som förenklar och gör vardagen lite roligare för oss alla.
   

  

 Rollen som DevOps-ingenjör hos oss är en omväxlande roll, med arbete på olika nivåer, där du får en chans att delta i våra kunders DevOps-resa utifrån deras mognadsgrad.
   

  

**Matchar vi?**
 Vi söker dig som blir uttråkad av att göra samma sak två gånger och genast börjar hacka ihop en automatiserad lösning istället. Vi ser gärna att du har automatiserat något som absolut inte behövdes automatiseras! Kanske hemma?
   

  

 De som jobbar med DevOps på HiQ har ofta en kodtung utbildning och har jobbat som DevOps engineer i några år. Vi ser gärna att du har en liknande bakgrund, då vi oftast tar oss an Stockholms mer avancerade uppdrag.
   

  

**Checklist**
* Högskole-/Universitetsexamen inom datateknik, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annan relevant inriktning
* Minst 3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


 Det är ett stort plus om du har tidigare erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Scripting
* Säkerhet
* Monitorering
* CI/CD-tekniker
* Containeriseringsverktyg och molnlösningar
* Automation i produktionsmiljö med många noder
* IP-nätverk, VPN, DNS, lastbalanserare och brandväggar
* Seamless/automatiserade byggscript för release management i olika miljöer


 Vi ser också gärna att du tidigare byggt sofistikerad infrastruktur med en hög grad av automation och är en förespråkare av infrastructure-as-code.

title: Relocate to Malta Project Manager (Project Delivery)(Consulting/Big 4)
Data Scientist in Fraud Prevention Team | SEB, Solna
description:
Do you see the potential in data and want to contribute to accelerating our data driven automation journey using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and other data driven automation tools? Then this might be the right challenge for you!
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Data Scientist to join our group of data professionals. Our Fraud Prevention Team is a function within the AML & Financial Crime Prevention Area supporting business across multiple business areas. Our mission is to empower Fraud Prevention by unlocking the potential of data we create in our processes to identify improvements with a focus on data driven automation. We provide support to enable data-driven decision-making and leverage process intelligence across Fraud Prevention.
   

  

 As a part of the SEB Group, we provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 2800 employees consistently strive to enhance business development and growth. If you want to be part of an engaging and enabling environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine.
   

  

 About the role:
   

  

 As a Machine Learning Data Scientist, you will play an important role in accelerating our organization's data journey and creating business value. In this role you are expected to understand business needs and pain points in the process flows that can be addressed through data-driven solutions. You will have to analyse large datasets, apply advanced statistical and machine-learning techniques to drive actionable insights, data-driven decisions and improve our fraud prevention solutions.
   

  

 At SEB, we embrace a hybrid work model, providing employees with eligible roles and tasks to work remotely up to two days a week.
   

  

 Core roles and responsibilities:
   

  

* Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs and identify problems that can be solved using AI/ML techniques.
* Identify opportunities for AI/ML use cases, focusing on optimizing our manual processes and improving customer service.
* Lead and drive data workstreams engaging stakeholders and cross-functional teams in the implementation of the solutions.
* Collect, clean and analyse large amounts of data from various sources using various tools, methods, and formats to create business insights.
* Create ML algorithms and models to address specific business challenges and identify business opportunities.
* Deploy models into the production environment, maintain, monitor performance and secure reliability.
* Collaborate with the Data, ML/AI, Cloud/Data Engineers, Data Scientists and DevOps teams across the bank to accelerate AI/ML use cases.
* Collect and refine business requirements using various methods, such as data-driven insights, interviews, document analysis and workflow analysis.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have:
   

  

* You have a strong academic background in Machine Learning and Data Science (at least hold a Master’s degree in relevant fields).
* You have working experience as a Machine Learning and Data Scientist or similar role for at least 3 years and have been involved in developing and deploying ML models for solving business problems.
* You have experience in MLOp’s principles and how to apply them and possible ideas into production.
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership.
* You have great communication skills and fluency in English.
* You have great data visualization techniques, the ability to create meaningful visualizations and communicate insights.
* You have experience working with big data platforms using Apache Spark and Hadoop.
* You have proficiency in Python, Scala and Java programming language and have experience working with ML.
* You have experience working with a Cloud solution (Google Cloud Platform is preferred).


 What we offer:
   

  

* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. If you have questions about the position, please contact Agnes Kemper at agnes.kemper@seb.se . Please note that we are not able to handle applications via email due to GDPR.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: C# .NET utvecklare till Sogeti i Stockholm
description:
**Vill du vara med och skapa värde för både dig själv och våra kunder, vara del av en härlig gemenskap och dessutom har ett intresse för tech.**
 Du är en engagerad systemutvecklare i allmänhet, men med fokus inom C# i synnerhet, som vill vara med på en utvecklande resa där du erbjuds bland annat skaparglädje, kompetensutveckling, frihet och trygghet. Vi söker dig som uppskattar hantverket, som ständigt vill utvecklas, som håller dig i teknikens framkant och som söker en ny utmaning!
   

  

 Som utvecklare hos oss kan du arbeta med många olika typer av uppdrag. Möjligheterna oändliga och du får vara med och utveckla samt utvecklas inom det du brinner för. Du kommer att bli en del av ett gäng härliga Sogetiare som brinner för teknik och att ha kul tillsammans på vägen.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet eller mer av systemutveckling inom C#/.NET, antingen inom backend eller fullstack.
* Arbetat enligt agila metoder och trivs med den typen av arbetsprocess.
* Ett plus är även om du har erfarenhet av devops utveckling med Containerinfrastruktur (Kubernetes, OpenShift/Docker/Rancher)
* Har mycket goda svenska kunskaper i både tal och skrift.


 Många av våra uppdrag är inom säkerhetsklassad miljö så säkerhetsprövningar kan förekomma.
   

  

 Om du känner att du har likvärdig erfarenhet och besitter de egenskaper vi söker, är du varmt välkommen att söka!
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
 Vi tror att du är en person som brinner för problemlösning och utveckling samt har förmågan att samarbeta i team. Din förmåga att både inspirera och bli inspirerad av andra visar på din flexibilitet och förmåga att anpassa dig till förändringar. Sist men inte minst så tror vi att du besitter en god förmåga att skapa förtroende och ta ansvar i kundrelationer samt för den teknik vi använder.
   

  

**Men här på Sogeti handlar det inte bara om vad du kan redan!**
 Vi tror på att ständigt lära oss och utvecklas tillsammans. Därför erbjuder vi inte bara spännande utmaningar utan också generösa möjligheter till vidareutbildning och karriärutveckling.
   

  

 Vi kallar det "Become Your Best". Så hur kan du bli den bästa versionen av dig själv hos oss? Vilka konkreta hjälpmedel finns? Och hur ser vi på att göra "karriär" på Sogeti? Ta en titt här: BecomeYourBest
   

  

 När vi fått in din ansökan säkerställer vi att du uppfyller de grundläggande kraven för tjänsten. Vi går igenom alla ansökningar löpande och är du en av de kandidater som bäst matchar tjänstens kravprofil kontaktar vi dig för en kortare telefonintervju.
   

  

**Viktigast av allt är att du trivs i rollen som konsult och vågar testa nytt. Är du den vi söker?**

title: Director, Software Development
description:
General information
Country
Sweden


City
Linkoping

41123

Description & Requirements
The Director of the Grid Team leads strategic initiatives to enhance grid platform, ensuring reliability and efficiency. This role requires occasional travel to various company locations. It is crucial for driving innovation and supporting the company's growth objectives.  

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:* Lead strategic planning and execution of grid platform projects.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project alignment with company goals.
* Oversee the development and implementation of innovative solutions.
* Manage and mentor team members to foster growth and productivity.
* Monitor and analyze grid performance to identify areas for improvement.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Communicate project progress and outcomes to stakeholders.
  

Basic Qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in the software industry.
* Proven track record of leading and managing large-scale projects.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills.
* Experience with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS…)
* Preferred Qualifications:
* Familiarity with Kubernetes and CNCF projects
  


  

About Infor  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com  


Our Values  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.

title: Hybrid Cloud Architect
description:
**We are looking for a Hybrid Cloud Architect. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting Solace-based messaging solutions. This role involves collaborating with various teams to understand their requirements and providing expert guidance to ensure the optimal use of Solace technology. The consultant will also be the primary point of contact for consumer teams, offering technical support and ensuring smooth integration and operation of messaging systems.**


### **Requirements**


* Lead the implementation of Solace solutions, including configuration and deployment.
* Collaborate with development teams to integrate Solace with various applications and systems.
* Conduct performance tuning and optimization of Solace environments.
* Provide technical support to consumer teams, addressing issues and resolving incidents.
* Monitor and maintain the health of Solace systems, ensuring high availability and reliability.
* Create and maintain documentation for troubleshooting and support procedures.
* Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements and define project scope.
* Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Conduct training sessions and knowledge transfer to internal teams and clients.
* Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Solace technology.
* Identify opportunities for improving existing solutions and processes.
* Participate in post-implementation reviews to identify areas for improvement.
* Provide expert guidance on managed services, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry standards.
* Evaluate and recommend managed service providers based on RFI responses and performance metrics.

title: Analytics and Insights Manager - Global Operations
description:
*Are you ready to make a meaningful impact on people’s lives with life-changing medicines? Join our team at AstraZeneca, where everyone feels a personal connection to the people we impact. From our science labs to manufacturing at scale, we are committed to delivering at the highest quality. It’s inspiring and rewarding work, influencing every part of the product lifecycle to deliver life-changing medicines. To ultimately make people’s lives better – from patients and their families to all of us in society!*

**Your accountabilities:**


As an **Analytics & Insights Manager**, you will be accountable for the delivery and development of reliable business intelligence and data analysis services which enable data-driven decision making throughout the External Supply and Manufacturing (ESM) organization. You'll be responsible for managing and overseeing the data management and reporting architecture in partnership with IT and ESM functions. Your role will also involve supporting business insight through the manipulation and analysis of data using statistical, machine learning and/or AI methodologies.

**What you'll do:**

* Develop the Analytics & Insights plan by defining common objectives and strategies across the organisation to ensure data is used effectively and efficiently in support of ESM strategy and goals
* Analyse, evaluate and report performance across ESM and provide analytical support within the organization
* Manage a set of important metrics for ESM and developing a roadmap with business partners to enhance them
* Provide data analysis and scenario modelling for strategic/business decision making
* Represent ESM on data management and review forums and partner with IT and the Global Business Process Management team for cross team and systems related topics
* Design and implement data engineering methods and processes to collect data from inside and outside of ESM by creating data models, policies, and standards that define and govern the type of data collected, how it is used, stored, managed, and integrated within ESM reporting and analysis activities
* Support important metric improvement through exploring Root Causes of variances, working with ESM data owners to understand variances and explore opportunities to improve them
* Contribute to the development of tools, standard process, playbooks, documentation and knowledge sharing in analytics and insights.

**Essentials for the role:**

* Bachelor's degree (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Math, Finance, or related) or 8 years of equivalent experience in analytics
* 6 or more year’s experience in Analytics, Procurement, Supply Chain and/or Finance
* Strong MS Office, Business Intelligence experience and database knowledge
* Proficient experience in Data Engineering/Architecture experience with some technical leadership
* Experience with Supply Chain and Procurement systems i.e. SAP ERP, Ariba
* Experience of Data Science Modelling, Visualization, Data Manipulation and reporting
* Ability to collect, organize, assess, analyze, integrate and visualize data and qualitative information from a variety of sources to assess business problems, build cases, track and monitor performance

**Desirables for the role:**

* Master’s degree or Post-graduate degree in advanced analytics/computing, math, science
* Experience with analytical software and dashboarding tools e.g. SAP Analytics in the Cloud, Qlik etc.
* Good understanding of E2E supply chain principles including metrics.
* Hands on experience working in a supply chain function

**Why AstraZeneca?**


When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. *That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office.* But that doesn’t mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.


At AstraZeneca, we are all about getting more medicines to patients quickly, affordably and sustainably. A key lever to making this a reality is technology. We are delivering internally and externally and transforming our ways of working. It means creating smart factories that help us to run better as well as make AstraZeneca a better place to work. Be part of impacting all parts of the business as we look for efficiencies, from robotic process automation in our factories to machine learning for quality batches.

**This is a place to embrace change, where we are willing to trial new solutions always with the patient and business in mind. Here data is used to improve our processes and deliver better for people in need. A diverse, multigenerational workforce, we are united by our curiosity, we share learnings and scale fast.**


Play an integral part in realizing our purpose: Delivering life-changing medicines. It's by being digitally-enabled that we can make a bigger impact and contribution to society, the planet and our business. Feel the backing and investment of our leaders as we accelerate our digital journey forward.


Are you ready to join us in this exciting journey?


Welcome with your application no later than **3 September** and let's make a difference together!
company_description: Build unrivalled capabilities in a place that promotes learning agility and offers development opportunities. We never standstill so you’ll have the chance to constantly grow your abilities.

title: Senior Solution Director
description:
HCL
  
HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we've never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We've always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments—no matter how big or small—can be traced back to an idea's single spark. To lead and drive the technology solutioning in LoB / vertical and to create a COE in cloud technologies and Apps migration.
  
About Role
  
This role requires frequent travel to Schengen countries
  
**Job Title:** Senior Solution Director
  
  

**Key Function:**  

To provide Data and Analytics Subject Matter Expertise / Solutions to clients. Industry Experience: Cross Industry Experience
  
  

**Key Objectives:**  

To be part of the EMEA Solution team crafting innovative SAP solutions
  
Analysis of business requirements
  
Provide a compelling proposition for HCLTech's SAP customer for their Digital transformation journey.
  
Design and implementation of full solutions.
  
Identify integration issues and develop solutions to these issues.
  
Coach and develop skills within a solutioning team.
  
Work effectively in mixed client and consultancy teams.
  
Willing and available to travel in Europe for HCLTech / Client Workshops.
  
Collaborate as a key member of the presales team to represent the solution offering to the client buyer.
  
  

**Skills/Knowledge/Experience Required:**  

Successful track record in crafting and leading SAP BI, BW/4HANA, Analytics – SAC, Data Lakes solution and delivering complex analytics project.
  
Knowledge of the dependency on and functional split with other applications (especially S/4HANA and how ECC to S/4HANA changes affect analytics solutions)
  
Ability to manage detail work on multiple work streams and communicate status effectively to all levels.
  
Proven ability to implement S/4HANA and MI, BI, Data/Analytics related solutions for demanding and challenging stakeholders at all levels across business sectors.
  
Track history of leadership.
  
Strong client facing consultancy experience.
  
Experience of working with multi-cultural team based across various geographies.
  
Language skills – Fluent in English (written and verbal)
  
  

**Competencies:**  

**Core Skills:**  

Effective as a Presales / Solution Lead managing RFI/RFP with end-end responsibility until close.
  
Strong commercial background working in SAP Solution pre-sales.
  
Demonstrates excellent communication skills both verbally and in writing.
  
Can conceptualize and communicate winning propositions.
  
Ability to articulate sophisticated solutions with clarity and rigour, and to tailor delivery to a mixed audience.
  
Bright, ability to rapidly pick-up new technologies, propositions, and business areas.
  
Outcome oriented – maximizing balance of effort vs benefit to achieve objectives.
  
Ability to work under own initiative and under tight time pressures - planning, prioritizing and controlling own workload.
  
Precise approach to project management and procedures
  
Ability to assert own ideas to clients and within HCLTech senior management.
  
Is able to give strong coaching and feedback where needed to HCLTech or client team members.
  
Continuous improvement - Inquisitive – "self-teaching" of relevant new business thinking and technology solutions.
  
Proactively contributes to the body of knowledge at HCLTech.
  
Uses a set of basic consulting tools Is able to conduct one-to-one interviews with middle managers.
  
Can contribute to a mixed workshop process.
  
  

**Role Competencies:**  

Detailed knowledge of business requirements and solutions in their focus area (Technology, Industry or LOB)
  
Mobilise and motivate a project team.
  
Ability to organise and co-ordinate diverse groups in complex situations.
  
Broad content experience across multiple lines of business
  
Broad technical appreciation – including ALL key SAP functionality and technology. With the ability to rapidly assess new technology solutions.
  
Lead functional / technical architecture in complex SAP and non-SAP environments.
  
Support the Programme Director to develop phasing strategy, plans, benefits case, organisational structures, risks and issues.
  
Command the respect and confidence of other Solution Architects, Solution Directors, and the Commercial Team
  
Ability to develop HCLTech's methods and tools and contribute to Solution Team strategy.
  
Manages design workshops on multiple area of expertise.
  
  

**Client Development:**  

Can contribute technical or procedural sections to a proposal.
  
Can present a proposal with the sales team.
  
Can identify and escalate business development opportunities.
  
  

**Delivery Excellence:**  

Able to effectively manage a team of client team members.
  
Understands delivery within a fixed price model and able to operate effectively within those constraints.
  
Can take ownership of sub-plans for specific IBP's and can plan own time to ensure project milestones are met.
  
Able to take an issue, then plan and deliver a solution using own initiative, with little guidance.
  
Identifies and escalates issues and risks within project structure.
  
Can build strong relationships with consultants within the project.
  
Able to receive feedback / coaching on performance from other members of the team positively.
  
  

Have a strong understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies.
